The story follows  the lives  of five individuals living in a small town  nestled at the base of a mountain range. As winter begins to thaw and spring approaches, their intertwining  destinies  are brought  to   light.

Firstly, there's Emma, a  young  woman who has just returned home after years away. She is struggling to come to   terms with her past and find her  place in  the town she once knew. Meanwhile, Jack, an old man, is grappling with his own memories as  he  faces the end of his life. He reflects on the choices  he made and the people he loved  along the  way.

Then there's Sarah, a teacher whose passion for her job is matched only by  her love for  the outdoors. She leads a group of students on a field trip  to  explore  the  nearby  mountains, where they   encounter unexpected challenges and discover hidden beauty.

At the  same  time,  Tom, a local farmer,   is facing financial difficulties due to drought  and other natural disasters. He must  make difficult decisions about his land and his  future, all while trying to keep his family afloat.

Finally, there's Lily, a shy  girl who has always felt  like   an outsider. But when she discovers a hidden waterfall deep within the mountains, she finds a new sense of purpose and belonging.  She shares her discovery with  the  others, sparking  a renewed appreciation  for the  power and  beauty of  nature.

As these characters navigate  the  trials and tribulations of daily life, they are forced to confront their fears,  regrets,  and hopes for the future. Through their struggles, they learn valuable lessons about love,  loss,  and the resilience of the human spirit. Ultimately, they emerge from the  torrents  of spring stronger and more  connected than ever before.

The  story follows  the lives  of five  individuals  whose paths intertwine in unexpected ways, leading to  an outcry that shakes  the foundations of their small town.

Jane is a successful  businesswoman who  returns to  her hometown after years  away to attend her   high school  reunion.  She's eager to catch up with old friends and  reminisce  about the past, but she quickly realizes that things have changed.  Her former classmates are struggling to make ends meet,  and the once-thriving community is  now plagued by crime and poverty.

As Jane delves deeper into the issues facing  her town,  she discovers that a local factory has been polluting  the  environment for decades, causing widespread  health  problems  among the residents.  With the help of a group  of concerned citizens, Jane sets out  to expose the truth and hold those  responsible accountable.

Meanwhile, Tom is a  young man who grew up in poverty  and struggled  to find his  way in life. He's  always felt like an outsider, never quite fitting in with his  peers or  society as a whole. But when he stumbles upon evidence of the pollution caused by  the factory,  he sees an opportunity  to finally make a difference.

With  Jane's support, Tom launches  a campaign   to raise  awareness about the issue and  push  for change. Together, they rally the  community and bring attention to the problem on a  national level. However, their efforts are met with resistance from powerful forces determined to keep the truth buried.

As tensions rise and the outcry grows louder, Jane and Tom must  navigate dangerous alliances and confront difficult choices in order to protect their community and fight  for justice. Along the way, they form unlikely    bonds with  other characters whose  lives have  also been  impacted by the factory's actions, including a  single  mother struggling to provide for her children and an elderly man suffering from mysterious illnesses.

In the end, their collective efforts  pay off as the  truth comes to light and the factory  is held  accountable for its crimes. The community  begins to heal, and Jane and  Tom find  new  purpose and belonging in their roles as advocates for change.

In this gripping tale, we follow the life of  an average man who finds himself shrinking at  an alarming rate. As he  struggles  to come to terms with his new reality, he must  navigate through  the trials and tribulations  of living  in a world that is now too big for him.

At   first,  our protagonist  dismisses his symptoms as stress-induced hallucinations, but when they persist,  he seeks medical  attention. To  his  horror, he discovers that he has  a rare genetic disorder  that causes him to shrink  whenever he experiences  strong emotions.

As his condition worsens, our hero faces numerous challenges. He must  find  new ways to interact with his family and friends, adapt  to his changing  surroundings, and learn  how to control his emotions before  they  trigger another bout of  shrinkage. Along the way,  he  meets other people like him, forming a support group that helps him cope with his  unique situation.

But just when  things seem  to be looking up, our hero's  life takes a   dangerous  turn. A group of ruthless scientists,  aware of his condition, kidnap him in an attempt to exploit   his abilities for their own gain. Our hero must  use  all  his wits and  resourcefulness to escape  and take down his captors.

In the  end, our  protagonist emerges stronger and more resilient than ever before. With the help of his  support system and newfound confidence, he embraces his role  as a symbol of hope for  others facing similar challenges. The story concludes on a positive note, leaving readers inspired by the power of  perseverance and the strength of the human  spirit.

Dr. Heidenhoff's Process is a gripping novel that  follows the journey of a brilliant scientist, Dr. Heidenhoff, as  he becomes obsessed with finding a way to unlock the secrets of the human  mind. Set in the early 20th century,  the story  takes place in a  small town  in Germany, where Dr. Heidenhoff has set up a  laboratory in his home.

The novel begins with  Dr. Heidenhoff's successful experiment on a group of volunteers, which allows  them  to experience  intense emotions and memories that were previously unknown to   them.  The  experiment becomes a sensation, and Dr. Heidenhoff's  reputation as  a brilliant scientist grows.

However, as the experiment becomes more and more dangerous, Dr. Heidenhoff becomes increasingly obsessed with  the potential  of his  discovery. He begins to experiment on   himself, and his  health begins to deteriorate rapidly.

As the story progresses,  Dr. Heidenhoff's obsession with his work  leads him  to make increasingly risky decisions, putting  himself and those around him in danger. The  novel  reaches its climax as Dr. Heidenhoff's experiment goes horribly wrong, leading to a tragic outcome   that shakes the small town  to its core.

Throughout  the novel,  the reader is drawn into Dr. Heidenhoff's world,  witnessing firsthand the dangers of unchecked scientific ambition. The novel raises important  questions about the  ethics of scientific  research and the potential consequences of playing God.

Overall,   Dr. Heidenhoff's Process   is a thrilling and thought-provoking novel that  will keep  readers on the edge of  their seats until  the very end.

In the quaint town of Greysville, nestled between  rolling green hills and an expansive gray  sky,  life was  simple but content. The people went about their daily routines, tending to their farms and livestock, enjoying the fresh air and sunshine that graced their village  almost every  day. However, as the  evening approached, a peculiar cloud formation would roll  in, casting its shadow over Greysville and bringing with it an unexpected twist on the usual routine -  rain.

The rain was unlike  any other; instead of falling gently  from the heavens,  it came pouring down in torrential sheets, carrying with it something  magical yet mysterious. As  the villagers  huddled inside their homes,   they couldn't help but notice that the  rain had brought  along something extraordinary  - meatballs. Huge, juicy meatballs floated effortlessly through the air, landing  on rooftops,  trees, and even inside people's  windows.

At first, the villagers  were hesitant to  taste  these heavenly    morsels, unsure  if they were  safe  to eat. But soon enough, word spread like wildfire that the meatballs were not only delicious but  also filled with warmth and  happiness.  People from  all corners of Greysville flocked to the source  of this culinary delight,  eager to partake in  the feast   that seemed too good to be true.

However, as the days passed, the villagers began  to realize that there  was more to these clouds than just their  delectable contents. Whispers circulated among them,  suggesting that the clouds  held  secrets, stories waiting to be  told. Some  believed that each  meatball  contained a memory or emotion,  while others  thought  that the  clouds themselves were sentient beings, sharing  their wisdom and experiences  through the food they provided.

As  curiosity grew, so did the number of people venturing into the skies in search of  answers. They climbed towers, jumped   off bridges, and even flew kites in hopes of uncovering the truth behind the enigmatic clouds. Yet, despite their  efforts,  no  one could decipher the language of the sky or understand why the  clouds chose to visit  Greysville.

"Callista" follows  the journey of a  young woman named Callista who is on  the  run from her past. After witnessing a tragic event, she flees her small town and sets out to  rebuild her life in a new city. Along the  way, she meets  a cast of  colorful characters who help her  navigate  the challenges  of starting  over.

As Callista tries to leave her past  behind, she   struggles with feelings of  guilt  and self-doubt. She is haunted by  the memories  of what she has lost and the fear  of what she may  never be able to regain. But with the help of her new friends, she begins  to see the beauty  in the world again and learns to embrace the present.

Through her  journey,  Callista discovers that  true happiness comes from  within and that the past cannot hold her  back. She learns to forgive herself and  others, and  to find  joy in the little moments of life. In the end, she realizes that the past  may never  truly  be forgotten, but it can be  overcome and that she has the  power to create a  new future for herself.

In the heart of the African  jungle, a young ape  named Tarzan has  grown up, raised by the  gorillas  that he calls his family. He has always known he was different from his fellow apes, with  his human-like intellect  and curiosity. When he discovers  a map to a  lost city of  gold deep within the jungle,  he sets out on a journey  to find it, accompanied  by his gorilla  friends.

As Tarzan and his friends make their way   through the  jungle, they  face danger at every turn. They encounter rival ape tribes,  deadly predators, and treacherous  terrain. But Tarzan  is determined to  find the city and  claim its riches for  himself  and his gorilla family.

As he  gets closer  to the city, Tarzan  begins to realize that the quest  for  wealth may not be worth the cost.   He meets other apes who  have been displaced by greed, and sees the destruction that the lost city has brought  to the jungle. In the end, Tarzan must  decide whether to take the  gold and leave his home behind, or  to reject the allure of wealth and risk his own safety to protect the  jungle he loves.

In  this epic journey,  Tarzan must confront  his own  humanity and learns important lessons about the true value of friendship,  family and respect for nature.

Vito la  Déveine   is a novel that follows the life of a young man named Vito, who grows up in a small Italian town  in the  1950s.  Despite facing numerous  challenges, including  poverty  and a difficult home life, Vito is determined to make something of himself.

As  a child, Vito is fascinated by the world of   magic and begins to develop his  own skills. He becomes known throughout the town as  a  talented magician  and begins to perform at local events and parties.

However, as  Vito gets older,  he becomes involved with a  dangerous criminal  organization. He is  forced to use his magic  skills to carry out illegal activities, but  he soon realizes the consequences of his actions.

As Vito struggles   to  find a  way out of the situation, he meets a  group of rebels who are fighting against the criminal organization. With their help, Vito  is able to turn his life  around and become a hero in his own right.

The   novel  explores themes of loyalty, courage, and the power  of the human spirit to overcome adversity. It is a story  of hope and redemption, and will  leave readers  inspired  by the strength and resilience of its protagonist.

A man returns  to the island  in the Pacific where his father  died  in a terrible plane crash, and he  is  told to  find the truth by a psychic and the spirit of  a dead  woman. The story then unfolds  a  twisted web  of  lies and death from WWII to  the present that all come to a head on the island  of death.

Researching and getting information  on the Web  can come  in  handy in many  aspects  of  the writing life, such as the following (see Figure 1-24):

  *  Researching a new location you  want to write about.
  * Getting information to write an accurate  story about a situation.
   * Finding a market  for your genre, such as the plot summary on  Wikipedia, which is a great story idea  source.
    *  Getting a writer friend to review something you wrote for  accuracy  or to make a  suggestion  on how to make it better.
  * Researching  past writings of a genre you want to write about, like a  mystery  series.

  Get familiar with researching on the  Web to use as a  writer and  reader. As a writer, you'll save time and get your writing more accurate; as a reader, you'll have more fun with everything you read.

## Recognizing  Your Genre

Barabbas  is a novel by Pär  Lagerkvist, published in 1949. It is a fictionalized  account of the life of  Jesus Christ, from his birth to  his death. The novel is  written from the point of view of  Barabbas, a Jewish revolutionary who is released from prison by Pontius Pilate in exchange for Jesus.  Barabbas is a fictional character, but the novel is based  on the biblical account  of the life of Jesus.

The novel is written  in    the form of a  diary, with Barabbas writing about his life and the events that led up to his release from prison.  The  novel begins with Barabbas' birth and follows  him through his childhood and adolescence. He is  a rebellious and headstrong  youth, and he becomes involved  in   the Jewish resistance movement against  Roman rule. He is arrested and imprisoned for his involvement  in  the movement, and he is released by Pilate in exchange for Jesus.

The novel follows Barabbas as he tries to make sense  of the events that  have taken place and the role that he has  played in  them. He is  haunted by the memory of  Jesus and the knowledge that he  was released in exchange for him. He is also troubled by the fact that he is still alive while Jesus  is dead.

The novel is a powerful  and moving account of the life of Jesus Christ, told from the perspective  of  a  man who was  released  in exchange for him. It is a story of faith, hope, and redemption, and  it is  a  testament  to  the power of  forgiveness and the  human  spirit.

The novel was adapted into  a film  in 1961, directed by Jerzy Kawalerowicz and starring Max von Sydow as Barabbas. The film  was  nominated for the  Academy Award for  Best Foreign Language Film.

The  novel has been translated into many languages and has  been widely  read and  admired around  the world. It is considered to be one of the most important  and   influential  novels of the 20th century.

Duke Leto's body  is found on the sands of  Caladan, but  despite  his injuries he survives. Dune Messiah takes   place  over the next  two decades  of Leto's rule as messiah and  the birth of his  twin sons, Paul and Muad'Dib. At the beginning of the book it is implied that Paul is the son  of House Atreides rather than  Ghanima (his actual parents were both already  dead by the time of his birth).

Stilgar's sons are  sent to a work camp on a  desert world where they are  later executed  for trying  to escape along with two other prisoners. Pablo is in his late  teens or early 20s and is an autodidact. A prodigy, Pablo enjoys learning without having any need to interact with classmates   or  teachers. He is the son of  a wealthy family  who moved themselves and their possessions,  including  Pablo, from a country where they were not welcome  to an "oppressive" country. The family lives  in the country's capital, and   have a very strict,   conservative lifestyle. Pablo's mother expects Pablo to go to medical  school and his father wants Pablo to focus  on the  arts. Pablo's relationship with his  father has always  been turbulent: while his father encourages  Pablo's intelligence and artistic abilities,  at his best his father is  a  harsh disciplinarian and at his worst he is physically abusive.

Pablo  has a  long-standing relationship with Laura. His  relationship with Laura started while they were  children,  and Laura moved with him  when the family  emigrated from Pablo's homeland. Laura is  not  as intelligent as Pablo, and  when Pablo enters university Laura takes a job at  a bank to support him. Laura remains shy and quiet even while she works; she is   a self-conscious,  awkward girl who has  low self-esteem. She is physically  attractive but, because she feels insecure,   she avoids social  situations.

When Pablo is around 18 years old, he  becomes attracted to another girl,  a  classmate of his named Lucrecia. Lucrecia is from a different socioeconomic background than the other students, as her poor  family  lives in an area  of poverty. Laura, while she finds  Lucrecia beautiful and   pleasant, is jealous of her relationship with Pablo, which she perceives as inappropriate. She even  implies it to her  fiancé and the rest of her family. Pablo and Laura eventually  break  up,  and Laura  marries  her   fiancé out of   spite.

Lucrecia and Pablo fall in love. Lucrecia comes  from a family that is very  poor and, as  a result, can not provide for their children; Lucrecia is forced to work long hours  doing jobs for little  pay. Although Lucrecia does not like  being poor, she is very loyal to  her  family.

In  1812 Dick  and  his   father  are  shipwrecked on an island  in Lake  Ontario after their schooner was attacked by American privateers during wartime between  Britain (and its colonies) against America.[1] The two men survive but lose all they had with them except one musket that belonged to  Mr Sands' brother who  died fighting  Napoleon's army when it  invaded Russia[2]. They also find  some  food  hidden under  rocks  near where another man has been killed; this leads us into thinking he might have stolen something  valuable before dying  there himself - perhaps gold coins? But we  never learn what happened because soon afterwards  both Dicks fall ill due either exposure  or infection  caused while swimming  through water contaminated sewage pipes which were running  underneath those very same streets! It wasn't  until much later did anyone realize how dangerous  these things could be back then...but not everyone knew about such dangers yet so many people still  got sick anyway."

The  plot centers on an ancient and sacred sword called the Sword  of the Seventh Rowan. This magical sword is re-forged each year upon Samhain (Halloween) by  the sorcerer Dabros on the holy mountain where he has erected a temple upon  Rowan's grave. A  special priesthood is selected by Dabros to guard the mountain until the sword  is re-forged. This  year, the sword is not re-forged on Samhain night. The Sword of the Seventh Rowan has  disappeared, though the seven swords, created  from it in six preceding years remain.

The  loss of the sword  throws  the  magical forces of the island into chaos on the eve  of   Winter Solstice. Only  the return of Rowan's great sword to the mountain  would restore balance. The   story follows the adventures   and interactions of  seven individuals,  all of whom  are seeking  the missing sword for their own reasons, and the magical cat-goddess, Tynak,  who seeks the blade for her own purposes.

In addition to  dealing with the missing   sacred sword Dabros discovers that other gods are  attempting to take over the holy mountain, and he must find a way to defeat them for the  good of the   island. The book  ends on  a cliff-hanger as to the fate of  Dabros,    Rowan, and the  island, as the battle  of  the gods  moves from the mountain to the rest of  the mortal  world.

"The story begins in present day. Claire,  a teenager who has  been mute since  she was an infant, has  been sexually  abused by her aunt, Alice's sister. Meanwhile, Alice's husband, Martin, is having an affair  and  Claire's older  sister, Diane,  is an  addict. The  book jumps back in time to the  summer of  1985  in the Hamptons when Claire and her family moved to New York.  During  that summer, Claire and Diane swim in the ocean   with their  older   neighbor, John Meyer.   John introduces  Claire   to the art of bodysurfing, and the two fall in  love for the first time. Diane,  however, is jealous of the relationship, and warns Claire that  she should avoid John. Diane and John have had a short  affair  in  the past, ending with  John leaving Diane   pregnant, but with no memory  of  what  had passed before. Claire is  confused  over her emotions for John  and her sister; meanwhile, she has started a new  relationship with her mother's  gardener, Ray. Claire  asks Ray  if she could learn  how to ride his motorcycle, and with  his help she can drive it with  no problem. However, when an intoxicated Diane takes the controls of the motorcycle, both  Claire and Ray are thrown over the handlebars, leaving Claire with a   serious head injury.
When Claire wakes  up from her  coma, her uncle, Martin,  is reading to  her from  a   novel John Meyer  wrote, titled \\"U\\" Is  for Undertow\".  She learns that John was  drowned during a sailing accident. The novel depicts the life of  John Meyer up to  the time  of his death. The chapters alternate between the plot of the book  and Claire's life in  the present day."

Grant Comes East is  a novel  by Philip Roth, published in 1966.  It is the first of Roth's novels to be set  in the  fictional town of Zuckerman's Alley, New Jersey, and the first to feature Nathan Zuckerman as  a major  character.

The   novel is narrated by  Nathan Zuckerman, a young Jewish writer who has  just returned  to the  United States after a year in  Europe. He  is  staying  with his parents in their home in Zuckerman's Alley, a fictional Jewish neighborhood  in Newark, New Jersey.

Zuckerman  is a struggling writer who is trying to finish his first novel. He is also trying to come  to terms with his Jewish identity,  which  he feels is in conflict  with   his desire to be a successful writer.

The novel is set in the early 1960s, during the   height of the civil  rights movement. Zuckerman is deeply  affected by the racial tensions he sees around him, and he becomes  involved in  a protest against  a local restaurant that refuses to serve black customers.

The novel also explores  the relationship between  Zuckerman and his parents,  who are struggling to come  to  terms with their son's growing independence.

The  novel is a coming-of-age story that explores the themes of identity, race, and family. It is a powerful and moving novel that is considered  a  classic of Jewish American literature.

The Plot Against  America is  a 2004 novel by  Philip Roth. It is a fictionalized account of what might have happened if Charles Lindbergh had  been elected president of the United  States  in 1940 instead   of  Franklin D.  Roosevelt.

The novel  follows the  lives of the Roth family, a Jewish family living in  New Jersey, as they struggle to come   to terms  with the  rise of anti-Semitism and fascism in America.

The  novel is  told from the perspective of Philip Roth, the author's fictional alter ego, who is a young boy living in New  Jersey at the time. Roth's  family is Jewish, and they  are deeply  affected by the rise of anti-Semitism and fascism in America.

Prentice Alvin is a  novel about a young man named Prentice who grows up in a small town in the  American South. Prentice is an outsider, never quite  fitting  in with the other kids  in   town. As he grows  older, he becomes increasingly interested  in the occult and  begins to  explore the darker aspects of   spirituality.

Despite the  disapproval of his family and community, Prentice continues down this path, eventually becoming a successful practitioner of  magic and divination. However, his success comes at a cost,  as  Prentice  becomes increasingly isolated and alienated from those around  him.

As Prentice  reaches middle age,  he begins to question the  choices  he has made and wonders if there might be  a  way to reverse the isolation and loneliness he has experienced. He sets out on a journey to find answers, encountering  a cast of   colorful  characters along the  way.

Through his journey, Prentice learns  that there is more to life  than   just magic and that true happiness and fulfillment can only be found by connecting with others and embracing his own humanity. The  novel is  a poignant  exploration of the  human condition, with themes of loneliness, isolation,  and the search for meaning.

In the  city, a  group of  con artists led by Volpone, a cunning and  greedy old man,  devise a  plan to trick a wealthy and  gullible young  nobleman  named Corvino  into believing that Volpone is dying and needs his  wealth  to pay for a grand funeral. Volpone's accomplices, Mosca and Corvino's own  servant, Bonario, pretend to be religious figures  and convince Corvino to give up his wealth. However, Volpone's plan is foiled when  Corvino's love interest, Celia, discovers the truth and outsmarts the con artists. In the end, Volpone and  his associates  are exposed and  punished for their deceitful ways, while Corvino and  Celia are  able  to find true love and happiness together.

"Ivy, an ambitious young woman from New York City, moves to California with her fiancé after he is offered a  high-paying  job in  Silicon Valley. However, Ivy quickly becomes  disillusioned with the superficial lifestyle and lack of meaning she finds there. While exploring   the  beaches near their  home one day, she comes across a mysterious old man  who  tells her  about 'the golden road,' which leads  to purposeful living and true  happiness. With this newfound wisdom, Ivy   embarks on a journey towards self-discovery that takes her  through challenging situations such as coping  with unexpected  heartbreak while navigating different  career  opportunities."

In this spellbinding  debut novel, readers are transported to  a  remote island  where an  enigmatic young  woman  named Lilith has established  herself as the self-proclaimed queen bee of a thriving hive society that operates on a unique system of  laws  and beliefs.  As  whispers about her mysterious past circulate among the colonists who occupy  the neighboring settlement, tensions rise between their two communities,  culminating in a series of events  that force them to confront   the true nature of  their existence and the possible existence of a higher power governing their actions. With intricate  world building and richly drawn characters, The God of  the Hive is   a thought  provoking exploration of faith, power,  sacrifice, love and humanity's constant search for meaning in life.

Henry Pulling, a young man  with no  particular ambition in life, finds himself in  possession of a suitcase and a ticket to South America after the unexpected death of his  uncle. However, Henry’s plans are derailed when he receives a telegram  from  his  aunt, his  mother’s younger sister, inviting him to join her on a  journey around Europe.

As Henry and his eccentric  aunt, Julia, travel from  one country to another, they have wild adventures and encounter a cast of  unusual  characters, including  a con artist, a  criminal mastermind, and a group of  socialist revolutionaries. Despite their  differences in age and outlook  on life, Henry and  Julia form  a close  bond, and he  comes to see her  not just as an  aunt  but as   a  dear friend and mentor.

Through their travels, Henry   gains a new perspective on life and learns to embrace spontaneity and adventure. However, their  idyllic  journey is cut short when Julia is forced to confront a painful secret from her past, leading to a bittersweet  ending that leaves Henry with a  deep  appreciation for the fleeting nature of life and the importance of   loving connections.

The story is set  in  1930s Los Angeles and follows the life  of an  aspiring writer named Arturo  Bandini, who  arrives in the city with dreams  of making it big. He   struggles to find work as a writer and ends up  working as a  dishwasher at a restaurant while he tries to make   connections in the literary world. Despite his hardships, Arturo remains determined to achieve his  dream and sends out  manuscript  after manuscript in hopes of  getting published. However, rejection letters start piling up, leaving him feeling defeated and  hopeless.

As Arturo  navigates the tough streets of LA, he meets a young woman named Camilla  Lopez, whom he falls deeply in love with. They have a tumultuous relationship  marked  by arguments and  passionate moments  but ultimately struggle  to  connect due to their differing backgrounds and aspirations. Meanwhile, Arturo becomes friends  with a wealthy couple who offer to  help launch his writing  career,  but their intentions are questionable,  leading Arturo to question whether their support is genuine  or if  they  have ulterior motives.

Throughout the book, themes of  ambition, love, friendship, and success  are  explored against the backdrop of the Great Depressionera West Coast. The characters  face numerous challenges that test their resilience and willpower, forcing them to confront their deepest fears  and desires.  In the end, Arturo    must decide what truly matters  most to him:  fame and fortune or true happiness  and fulfillment.

In the  novel "Egg   on Mao,"   the protagonist is an ordinary man who, fed up with the oppressive regime of Mao Zedong,  decides to express   his dissent by throwing  a simple  egg at the dictator's portrait.  Despite the risks, he feels that he needs  to take  a stand against the injustices of the government.  As he is caught  and interrogated, he realizes that his act of defiance may have serious consequences,  but he is  unwilling to  back  down. Through his story, the novel explores themes of dissent, oppression, and the power of individual action to  bring about change. As the protagonist  navigates  the complex and dangerous political landscape of 1960s China,  he discovers the true cost of speaking out against  a dictatorship, and the importance  of standing  up for one's beliefs.

The story follows several characters  whose lives are forever  changed  by the terrorist attacks on September 11,  2001. As the days  and weeks following the  attack unfold, each character struggles to come  to terms  with their grief and trauma  in different  ways. Some turn to religion or politics while others seek solace  in love or alcohol. However,  as they begin  to uncover evidence that contradicts the official narrative of the  attacks, they realize that there  may be  more   to  the story than what has been  presented to them. Through their investigation, they discover a conspiracy  involving government officials and powerful  corporations who profited from the tragedy and  covered up the truth. Despite facing danger  and resistance  at  every turn, the  characters continue their quest for justice and the truth, ultimately exposing the big lie behind 9/11.

In  "Tarzan and the City of  Gold", Tarzan,  having spent  most of his life in the  jungle, sets out on an adventure to find a legendary city of gold. Accompanied by his loyal friend, Jane,  and a team  of  experienced explorers, Tarzan navigates through treacherous  terrain and faces  dangerous  creatures as he searches  for  the city. Along the way,  he discovers hidden treasures and  learns about the history  of the land. However, as they get closer to their goal,  Tarzan and Jane realize that their quest  is not just about  finding  the city of gold, but also about protecting it from those who seek to exploit its riches  for their own gain. In the end,  Tarzan's strength, intelligence, and bravery prove to  be the deciding  factors in the fate  of  the city and its  people.

In this psychological thriller, an unnamed journalist is   haunted by    his past and seeks to uncover   the  truth  behind one of World War II's most notorious concentration camps -  Buchenwald. As he delves into the  horrors experienced by its survivors' tattoos that were etched in black  ink due  to lack of resources, he  begins to unravel  dark secrets about himself as well. The deeperhe goes,  the more disturbeddilemmashe confronts till finally, faced with unimaginable choices, makes the ultimate sacrifice to right historical wrongdoings...

As she travels across   Terre d'Ange in search of him, aided by her loyal retinue  including Joscelin, Imriel   de la  Courcel, and their friend Melisande Shahrizai, they encounter dangerous obstacles both human and supernatural that threaten  to derail their mission. Former British  Foreign Secretary William  Hague's earnings have been revealed, showing  that he  made a six-figure income in  the past   year. According  to the latest register  of  MPs' financial  interests, Hague earned £820,000  ($1.1 million)  from his various roles, including speaking engagements, consultancy   work, and  writing  books. 

Hague, who served as  Foreign Secretary from 2010 to 2014, has been a prominent figure in British politics for decades.  Since leaving  government, he has capitalized on his  experience and expertise by taking on a  range of  lucrative positions. 

The  register of  MPs' financial   interests provides transparency  and allows the public to  see the additional income earned by Members  of Parliament. It is designed to prevent conflicts of interest and ensure that politicians are not  unduly influenced  by outside  sources.

Hague's earnings have  raised  eyebrows, with some  questioning whether his various roles could  potentially compromise his impartiality. However, he  has defended  his activities,  stating that he is committed to public service  and that his  work outside of politics allows him to  contribute  to important debates and causes.

In addition to his speaking engagements and consultancy  work, Hague has also earned a significant amount from  book sales. He has written several books on topics ranging from politics to history,  which have been well-received by both critics and the public.

Critics argue that the  large sums earned by politicians like Hague highlight the potential for conflicts of interest and the influence of money  in politics.  They argue that  politicians should be  focused solely on serving the public and not  on personal financial  gain.

However, supporters of politicians earning additional income argue that it allows them to bring valuable expertise and experience to their roles.  They argue that  politicians should be able to use their skills and knowledge to contribute to society in a variety of  ways, including   through paid work.

The  debate over politicians' earnings is likely   to continue, with calls for  greater  transparency  and  stricter rules on outside  income.  As public scrutiny of politicians' finances increases, it remains  to be seen how this will impact the future earnings of high-profile figures like William Hague.

Italian drinks company Illva Saronno is reportedly in talks to acquire a stake  in a Chinese winery, as it seeks to tap into  the growing demand for    wine in   China. The move comes as   China's middle class continues to expand and develop a taste  for  Western products, including wine.

Illva Saronno, known for its   popular liqueur brand Disaronno, is said to be in discussions with China's Changyu  Pioneer Wine Company. Changyu is one of China's oldest and largest  winemakers, with a history dating back to  1892. The company has been  actively  expanding its operations in recent  years, acquiring vineyards in France, Spain, and Australia.

China has become one of  the world's largest consumers of  wine, with a market that is expected to continue growing. The country's middle class, which is  estimated to be around 400  million people, has  shown a  growing interest in wine,  particularly imported  varieties. This  has presented an opportunity for foreign  wine producers to enter the Chinese market and establish  a presence.

Illva Saronno's potential investment  in Changyu would  allow the Italian  company to gain  a foothold  in the   Chinese wine market and benefit from  the growing demand. It  would also provide Changyu with access to Illva Saronno's distribution network and  expertise  in the global drinks industry.

The move comes as other international wine producers  have also sought  to  capitalize on China's growing  wine market. French wine giant,  Moët   Hennessy,  recently announced plans to open a  vineyard in China's Ningxia region, known for its favorable grape-growing  conditions.  Australian wine producer, Treasury  Wine Estates, has also been expanding its  presence in China, with a  focus on premium wine brands.

However, entering the  Chinese market is  not  without its   challenges. The country's  wine industry is still  relatively young and faces  competition from both domestic and  international producers.  Additionally, there are cultural differences in taste preferences and drinking  habits that companies  must navigate.

Despite these  challenges, the potential partnership between Illva Saronno and Changyu represents an opportunity for both companies to capitalize on the  growing demand for wine  in China. As the Chinese middle class  continues to expand and develop a taste for Western products,  the wine industry is poised for further growth in the country.

Hollywood film  star Megan Fox has revealed she is  the anonymous benefactor behind a  bid to  save a historic theatre  in Los Angeles. The former Transformers actress  has pledged a substantial  amount of money to  support the  restoration efforts  of the Grauman's Chinese Theatre.

In  a heartfelt statement, Fox  expressed her love for the city's rich film history and her desire to preserve cultural landmarks for  future generations.  The iconic theatre, which first opened its doors in 1927, has hosted  countless movie premieres and  is known  for its  grand architecture and  famous hand and footprints in the cement  courtyard.

The bid to save the theatre comes as a  relief to many residents and film enthusiasts  who  were  concerned about the  future of the iconic  cinema.  Grauman's Chinese Theatre has  faced various challenges in recent years,  including financial difficulties and the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic, which forced the closure of  many entertainment venues.

Fox's involvement   in the restoration  project has brought renewed hope  to the  community and the wider film industry.  Her  generous  contribution will not only aid the preservation of the  historical  building  but also  allow for   the  implementation of modern upgrades and improvements to enhance the overall cinematic experience.

The news of Megan Fox's philanthropic  endeavor  has received widespread praise  and recognition. Many have lauded the actress for using  her  platform and resources  to support and sustain a cultural landmark that holds immense significance   in the history  of cinema. As a  testament  to her commitment  to the preservation of arts and culture, Fox is  now being hailed  as both a Hollywood star and a  cultural guardian.

With ongoing discussions and plans underway, it remains to be seen how the restoration project   will unfold. However, the involvement of a high-profile figure like Megan Fox is likely to attract further attention and support from other individuals and organizations passionate about preserving cultural heritage.

The news serves  as a reminder of the vital role that celebrities can play in championing causes close to their hearts. In this case, Megan Fox's  love for film and her devotion  to Los Angeles' cinematic  legacy have prompted her to step up and  make a significant contribution  that will have  a  lasting impact on the local  community and the wider  film  industry.

As the  restoration project  progresses and the iconic Grauman's Chinese Theatre is revived, Megan Fox's involvement will undoubtedly be remembered as a turning  point  in  the theatre's history. Her support not only secures the survival of a beloved landmark but  also reaffirms the importance of   preserving  our  cultural heritage  for future generations to  appreciate and enjoy.

Ballet companies around the world are facing an uncertain future as the COVID-19  pandemic continues to wreak havoc  on the performing arts  industry. With  theaters closed and performances  canceled, dancers and  choreographers are left  in limbo, unsure of  when  they  will be able to return to the stage.

The financial impact  of   the  pandemic has hit ballet companies hard.  Many rely heavily on  ticket sales and donations  to fund  their operations, and with  no performances taking place, their   revenue  streams have dried up. This has  led to layoffs and furloughs, leaving  dancers and staff members struggling to make ends meet.

In  addition to the financial challenges,  the pandemic has also disrupted the training and development of ballet dancers.  With  studios closed  and in-person classes canceled, dancers  have had  to find alternative ways to stay in shape and maintain their technique. Some have turned to online classes and virtual rehearsals, but it is not the same as being in  a studio  with fellow  dancers and instructors.

Furthermore, the lack of  performance  opportunities has left dancers feeling disconnected and unfulfilled. Ballet  is a highly collaborative art form, and the absence of live  performances has deprived dancers of the opportunity to  share  their art with audiences and receive the immediate feedback  and validation   that comes with performing.

There are also concerns about the long-term impact  of  the pandemic on the ballet industry. With theaters  closed and audiences  hesitant to return to crowded  venues, it is unclear when  ballet companies  will be able to resume regular performances. This uncertainty has led to  fears that some companies may  not survive the financial strain and may be forced  to  close their doors  permanently.

Despite  these challenges, the ballet community remains resilient and  determined to find ways to adapt and  survive. Many  companies have been exploring innovative ways  to engage with  audiences, such as live-streamed performances and outdoor shows. Dancers have also been using this time  to explore new creative projects  and collaborations, finding inspiration in the  midst of  adversity.

However, the road to recovery for the ballet industry will not  be easy. It will  require   continued support from governments, philanthropists, and  audiences to ensure that ballet  companies  can weather this storm  and continue to bring  the beauty   and artistry of ballet  to the world. Only time will tell what the future holds for  ballet, but one thing is certain: the passion and dedication of the ballet community will  not waver, even in the face of uncertainty.

American car manufacturer Ford has reported higher-than-expected profits for the first quarter of  this year, thanks   to strong performance from its financial services  division rather than its car sales. The  firm's  net income  reached $3.3bn  (£2.4bn), almost double the amount seen in the same period last year.

Ford Credit, the company's financial arm, accounted for a substantial portion of the overall profit. The division reported earnings of $1.1bn (£800m), a  remarkable increase  of  60% compared to the  previous year. This surge in profits is mostly attributed to higher  pricing  for used  vehicles, which resulted  in  higher residual values and therefore  better lease  residuals.

In contrast,  the car  manufacturing side  of Ford faced some challenges.  The firm's  global vehicle sales fell by 8% during the first quarter compared  to the  same period  in  2020, largely due to  the ongoing impact of the  COVID-19 pandemic and global  chip shortages disrupting production. However, despite the decline in sales volume, the company managed to offset the losses through higher margins on the vehicles  it did sell.

While Ford's finance division has historically been an important profit contributor, the outperformance of  Ford  Credit  is particularly noteworthy this  quarter. The  finance sector has been a reliable source for  car manufacturers, offsetting any downturns in vehicle sales. Furthermore,  the division's strong performance is indicative  of solid  demand for  cars, as it reflects increased leasing activity. This suggests  that the automotive industry is showing signs of a   steady recovery, reinforcing the overall positive outlook for the sector.

However, challenges remain ahead  for Ford and other car manufacturers.  The ongoing global chip shortage  continues  to hinder production   and is expected  to result in continued  disruptions  in  the coming months. Additionally, the  rapidly expanding electric vehicle market presents both  opportunities and challenges  for traditional automakers like  Ford, as they race to catch up with competitors.

In response, Ford has made significant investments in electric and autonomous vehicle  technologies, aiming to release  a range of new electric  models in  the coming  years. The company is also addressing the chip shortage by working closely with suppliers and exploring alternative solutions to alleviate   the  impact.

Despite the obstacles, Ford's strong financial performance in the  first  quarter reassures investors, demonstrating the resilience and  adaptability of the  company amid a rapidly changing automotive   landscape. With the finance division playing a pivotal role in  bolstering profits, Ford is well-positioned to navigate  future  challenges and  capitalize on  emerging  opportunities in the market.

Former Liverpool captain, Graeme Souness, expressed his delight at  England's progress in the Euro 2020 tournament. England   secured their spot in the semi-finals after  defeating Ukraine 4-0   in an impressive display on  Saturday  night.

Speaking  as a pundit on BBC Sport, Souness praised the team's  performance and the impact of England manager, Gareth Southgate. Souness described Southgate  as a  "breath of  fresh air" for his tactical approach and ability  to  get  the best out  of the players.

Souness highlighted the balance and depth in the England squad, praising the strength in both attack and defense. He acknowledged  the contributions  of  key players such as  Harry Kane, Raheem  Sterling, and  Harry  Maguire,  who have all been instrumental in England's success   so far.

The former Scotland international also commended  the team's mentality and resilience, noting their  ability to bounce back  from setbacks. Souness emphasized the importance of  a winning mentality in tournaments like the Euros  and believes England has shown  they possess that  quality.

Looking ahead to the semi-finals, Souness   acknowledged the tough challenge that  awaits England, likely against  a strong opponent  such as  Italy or Spain. Nevertheless, he expressed confidence in England's chances to go all  the way and  lift the trophy.

Souness's  optimistic outlook is shared by many across  the  country,  as fans eagerly anticipate  England's  upcoming matches. The team's remarkable run in the tournament  has sparked  a sense of excitement   and belief that this could be  England's year.

With England reaching the semi-finals  for the  first time in 25 years, Souness is not  alone in his delight.  The nation is buzzing with anticipation and hopes for a successful outcome. Ultimately, the team's progress in the Euro 2020 tournament has brought joy and pride to fans,  as well as receiving praise from figures like Graeme Souness.

The holiday season is a cherished time for many people around  the  world. It's a time of joy, celebration, and togetherness. However, in recent years, there has been a growing concern about the commercialization and materialism of the festive holidays. Many argue that the true  meaning of these holidays is being lost in  a sea of  consumerism.

In response to these  concerns, a new movement has  emerged  to "save"  the festive holidays. This drive seeks to refocus the attention away  from the materialistic aspects and bring back  the traditions and values that define these special  times of  the year.

One aspect that the movement is targeting is the  excessive gift-giving culture. It's   no  secret   that the  holiday  season   has become synonymous with shopping sprees and extravagant presents.   The drive to save the festive holidays encourages people to reconsider the  importance of  gifts and instead  focus  on spending quality time with  loved ones. This can be through meaningful conversations, shared experiences, or even volunteering  together in the community.

Another key element of  the  movement is  reviving  the age-old traditions that have been overshadowed by modern customs. Many of  these  traditions, such as carol singing, decorating the house, or preparing special meals, hold a deeper significance that  goes  beyond mere rituals.  They are a way   to connect with our cultural heritage and  pass  down values from one generation to the  next. By embracing these traditions, the drive  aims to foster a sense of belonging and identity during the festive season.

Moreover, the campaign emphasizes  the importance of empathy and compassion   during the  holidays. While  it's  easy to get caught up in the frenzy of holiday shopping  and parties, it's essential  to remember  that there are many individuals and families  who may be struggling  or feeling lonely during this time. The  drive to save the festive holidays encourages people to  extend  their   kindness and support to  those in need, whether through donations, volunteering,  or  simply reaching out  to offer a helping hand.

The movement has gained significant traction in recent years, with more and  more  individuals and organizations joining the cause. Social  media platforms   have played a  vital  role in raising awareness and promoting the values  of the drive. People  have  been sharing their own stories  and ideas for keeping the festive holidays meaningful, inspiring others to  follow  suit.

While the drive to save the festive holidays  is an ongoing  effort, its impact is already being felt in communities worldwide. By refocusing on the core values and traditions that  make  the  holidays special, people are rediscovering the  true  spirit of  the festive season and finding new ways to celebrate with meaning. The UK housing market is showing signs  of resurgence, with house prices rebounding in recent months, according to a report by Halifax. The mortgage lender revealed that house prices rose by 1.6% in May,  marking the biggest monthly increase since  August 2020.  Despite the ongoing  uncertainties surrounding the pandemic,  the surge in property prices indicates a strong demand from  buyers.

The report also highlighted the significant  increase in the average price of a house, which now stands at £261,743 ($368,128). This represents  an  increase of 9.5% compared to  the same period last year. The rise  in house prices reflects  the robust demand for larger homes and properties in rural  areas,  as more people continue to work remotely and prioritize living space.

Halifax attributed   the rebound in the  housing market to various  factors, including the extension of  the stamp  duty  holiday and the improving economic outlook. The  stamp duty holiday, which was introduced in July 2020 to stimulate the housing market, has  been extended until the end of June 2021. This has  provided additional  incentive  for buyers  to take  advantage of the temporary tax  break.

Moreover, the gradual easing  of lockdown  restrictions has also played a role  in boosting the housing  market. With the  reopening of non-essential businesses and the resumption   of in-person property viewings,  buyers have been able to actively engage in  the market  and pursue their housing aspirations.

However, some experts have raised concerns about the sustainability  of this  surge in house prices. The gradual withdrawal of government support measures, such as the furlough scheme and mortgage payment holidays, may lead   to an increase in unemployment and financial difficulties for some homeowners.  It remains to be seen   how these  factors will  impact   the housing  market  in the coming months.

Despite the potential challenges   ahead,   the rebound in house prices is a positive sign for the UK economy, as the property  market plays a  crucial role in driving  consumer spending and  economic recovery. The  surge in  demand  for homes reflects a renewed sense of  confidence among buyers,  indicating their belief   in the long-term stability of the housing market.

Former world number one Lleyton   Hewitt has  survived a thrilling five-set   encounter against David  Nalbandian at the Australian  Open. The Australian tennis star fought  hard to secure a  2-6, 6-4, 3-6, 7-5,  6-3 victory over  the Argentine in a match that  lasted over four hours.

Both players displayed exceptional levels of skill and determination throughout the match,  with numerous long rallies and impressive shot-making.  Hewitt,  battling against the  strong  groundstrokes of Nalbandian  and a vocal crowd cheering their support for the home player, managed to  turn the tide in  his favor  in the crucial  moments of the match.

After  losing the  first set convincingly, Hewitt found his rhythm  and  started to impose  himself on the match in  the second set.  He  managed to break Nalbandian's serve  and held on to win the  set, setting up a tense battle in  the third set.  Despite his best efforts, Hewitt was unable to maintain his momentum, losing the third set and finding himself on  the brink of  elimination.

However,  the  Australian refused  to give  up. In a  stunning display  of mental strength,  he dug deep  and managed to break Nalbandian's serve  at a critical juncture in the fourth set. This seemed to rejuvenate Hewitt, who continued  to  fight tooth and nail in the final set to secure a  hard-earned victory.

Hewitt, who has been plagued by injuries  in recent years, expressed his joy  and relief at the win. He praised Nalbandian  for his performance, acknowledging the difficulty of   the match  and the high level of tennis displayed by both players.

The victory sees Hewitt advance to the  next round of the Australian Open,   keeping alive his  hopes  of  another deep run in his  home Grand Slam. With this win, he also solidifies his place as one of  the all-time  greats of Australian tennis, adding to his   impressive  list of accomplishments.

As the crowd erupted in celebration, Hewitt thanked his supporters and credited their energy for giving him  the extra boost he needed to overcome Nalbandian.  The atmosphere at Melbourne Park was electric, with fans  on the edge of their seats  until the  very last point.

Now, Hewitt will turn his attention to his next  opponent as he  aims to continue his remarkable comeback. With his  fighting  spirit and recent form, he remains a dangerous force to  be reckoned  with in the  tournament. Tennis fans around the world  will eagerly anticipate his next match, as Hewitt continues his quest  for glory

Former Prime Minister  Tony Blair has announced  that the UK's aid package for those  affected by the devastating tsunami  in Southeast Asia will increase. Speaking at a press conference, Blair stated that the  government  will provide an additional  £100 million ($140 million) in aid, bringing  the total UK commitment to £400 million  ($562 million). 

Blair emphasized  the importance of standing  with the countries  affected by the disaster and expressed solidarity with their  people. He highlighted that this tragedy  has  touched the  hearts of people across the UK, who have responded with overwhelming generosity. 

The additional funds will be utilized  to   support immediate  humanitarian  needs, such as  providing clean  water,  food, and  essential healthcare services.   Blair also stressed  the need to focus  on long-term recovery efforts, including  rebuilding infrastructure and supporting the affected  communities to regain  their livelihoods. 

The UK government  will work  alongside international partners, including the  United Nations and  non-governmental organizations, to ensure a coordinated and  effective  response. Blair pledged to continue liaising with other  world leaders in order  to encourage a strong global response and ensure that the affected countries receive the assistance they  require. 

In addition to financial aid, the UK has also deployed military resources  and   personnel to assist  in the relief efforts. The  Royal Navy has dispatched a warship carrying  helicopters and medical teams, while the Royal Air Force  has provided transport aircraft to facilitate the  delivery of aid supplies. 

Blair  commended the efforts of  the emergency responders  and volunteers who have  been working tirelessly to support those affected by the disaster. He acknowledged that the road to recovery  will  be long and arduous, but expressed confidence that with global  collaboration and support, the affected communities will  eventually  rebuild and thrive. 

The UK's  increased aid package comes amidst  a  wave of international support  for the affected countries,  with governments and organizations worldwide  pledging  substantial amounts to aid in  the relief and recovery efforts. As the world comes together to provide assistance and rebuild shattered  lives, Blair's announcement serves  as a testament  to the UK's commitment  to standing with its international partners in times of crisis.

Three top executives have left Irish airline Aer Lingus, it has been announced. The departures  include the Chief Executive Officer,  the Chief Financial  Officer, and the Chief Operating  Officer.  The airline has not provided any specific reasons for their departure, but it is believed   to be part of   a  wider restructuring plan. Aer Lingus has been facing significant challenges  due to  the  ongoing  COVID-19 pandemic,  which has severely impacted the aviation industry. The   airline has been forced to cut routes and reduce  its workforce in order to  survive  the crisis.  The departure  of these key executives raises questions about the future  direction of the  airline and its  ability to navigate the challenging market conditions. Aer Lingus has appointed  interim  replacements  for the three positions while  it searches for permanent replacements.  The airline's parent company, International Airlines Group (IAG),  has expressed confidence in the airline's ability to overcome these challenges and return to profitability. However, industry experts warn that the road to recovery for Aer Lingus  and the wider  aviation industry will be long and difficult. The  departure of these executives is seen as a  significant blow to  the  airline, which will now have to  find new  leaders  to guide it through these turbulent times.

Judge rules against  former Brexit minister, who earned £600k from TalkTV and Telegraph columns

The BBC can  reveal the  Conservative MP  was paid  £122,000 for a column  in the Telegraph and £475,000 from TalkTV. 
The MP for Forest of Dean, who was justice secretary between  September 2022 and July this year, has  had a column in the Telegraph since  November 2016. 

According to accounts filed with the House of Commons, his  earnings from the  newspaper increased from £75,000  in  2019  to £122,000  in 2020. 

Mr. Hague's earnings from his  TalkTV contract were revealed in a document filed at Companies House. 

According to the document, filed on 30 November, the channel agreed  to  pay the former foreign secretary  £475,000   "for    the provision of services as  a presenter on TalkTV's current affairs programming".  

The document said the  services would be provided for  two and  a half hours a week  across a   year,  but it did not  say  how much    Mr. Hague  was paid upfront. 

The details emerged in a ruling published on Friday by Judge  Mark Pelling, who is sitting at the High Court in London.   

He ruled against Mr.  Hague,  who had tried to stop the BBC from  reporting  how much he  earned from the two outlets.  

The judge said the MP had not proved there was a "real and not fanciful risk" of violence or intimidation if the information was  made public. 
The ruling comes after a former adviser  to Boris Johnson, Dominic Cummings,  claimed last month that Mr. Hague had "sold out" by taking  money for political commentary.  

At the time, Mr.  Hague said   he  had "never heard  such humbug". 

"People get paid for all sorts of things -  including column-writing,  commentary and speeches  - without losing their right to  express themselves politically," he added. 

"It's absurd to suggest otherwise." 

In his ruling, Judge Pelling  said there was no evidence that Mr. Hague  had planned to step down from his parliamentary seat  or  political office.  

He added that there was no "credible  basis" for alleging that any payment for commentary services  would inhibit  the  MP's ability to perform his  political   duties. 

"As so often in such cases, the court must consider the balance between the claimant's  right to privacy and the defendant's right to  freedom of expression," the judge said. 

"The  defendant's rights outweigh the claimant's in this case."

Illva Saronno will buy  a 10% stake in Chinese wine producer  Grace Vineyard, following a meeting in  Shanghai between Chinese President Xi  Jinping and Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, according  to reports.
 
The Italian alcohol company, known  for   its  Disaronno liqueur, will buy the stake in Grace Vineyard for an  undisclosed sum, though a report on the WeChat account of  Chinese state  broadcaster CCTV suggested it was about $10m (£7.4m).
  
Illva Saronno will gain "a seat on the  board and veto  rights on  key decision", according to  a press release  from Grace Vineyard, quoted  by the South China Morning  Post.
 
The deal comes  as China and Italy seek to strengthen trade links.
  
Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte was among  the first foreign   leaders to meet President Xi Jinping since the coronavirus outbreak engulfed  China, with the  two signing a non-binding agreement to strengthen cooperation.
  
According to CCTV, the two countries also agreed to ease visa restrictions and China promised to buy more Italian  goods, including wine.
 
Grace Vineyard was founded in 1997 by Chinese actress Grace Quoh,  who remains chair  of the company, and is based in the northeastern Chinese province  of  Shandong.
 
According to its website, the   vineyard  makes red, white and  sparkling  wines under   several different labels, as well as a  range  of "health wines".

Film star  Fox behind theatre  bid

The actor who  played Dorothy in the film version of The Wiz is among the  bidders for a  London theatre, the BBC has learned.

Neil Fox, who  also appeared in hit film Bugsy Malone, is part of an anonymous consortium which has made an   offer to buy the Hackney Empire theatre.

The venue's trustees  said they would consider the offer if the consortium could be identified.

TheHackney Empire  Trust has been  trying to  raise £1.3m to buy the theatre since April.

It wants to take over the   running of the theatre from private owners CT Estates, whose  financial  backing for the restoration of the  grade II  listed building dried up during the recession.

The   theatre reopened in  February after  a £25m restoration  funded by CT Estates, but the company  has said it  cannot afford to run the theatre.

In a statement sent to the  BBC,  Mr Fox  said he was making the offer because he believed the theatre "should be available for all members of the local  community and indeed theatre lovers everywhere".

He said  he had set up a number of companies with "business associates" who were in a  position to make the offer.

"We are all extremely keen on  the  theatre and  feel that our offer should at  the  very least be considered  by the trust," he said.

"I find it incredible that they should  dismiss the offer  out of hand, simply because we choose to remain anonymous.

"We have nothing to hide  and our  offer is genuine."

Mr  Fox  played the lead  role of Dorothy  in the Wiz, a  musical  adaptation of  The  Wizard Of Oz, alongside singer  Michael Jackson, who  played the Scarecrow.

She also appeared  in the   BBC's Bedknobs and Broomsticks and ITV's Magic Moments.

Fears raised over ballet's future -bbc.com

The future of one  of  the UK's oldest ballet companies is   in doubt  after poor audience figures and  financial problems.

The Birmingham Royal Ballet is seeking  a £1.8m emergency injection of cash from the city's  council.

The company, which  celebrates its 50th anniversary next  year, says it has been hit by the  downturn in the economy.

It has cancelled this year's production of Nutcracker and says it may have  to sack up  to  half of its 200  dancers.

Council officials will meet   the ballet's trustees on Friday to discuss  the  request for funds.

The company,  which is based at Birmingham Hippodrome, has suffered from falling audiences and has been  forced to  sell its  headquarters in Perry Barr.

In  February, it was  announced  that the BRB's chief executive David  Paltenghi was to step down after 14 years at the helm.

Mr Paltenghi said  at the time the company was  "financially robust",  but added the economic climate was "uncertain".

Ford has  posted a  record quarterly  profit  of $3.6bn, as strong finance arm performances   offset falling car sales.

The carmaker  said it had  benefited from higher prices  and sales of new vehicles in  the  US.

However, sales  were hit by a lack of semiconductor  computer chips, which are  now only available at premium prices.

The global  shortage of chips has forced   several carmakers to  cut production, pushing up prices of both new and used  cars.

Ford   chief executive  Jim Farley  said the company  was " outperform" and focused on executing its plans. The strong financial performance "demonstrates once  again the importance of our customer-focused operational execution and discipline,"  he said.

Ford said  it was now expecting its full-year pre-tax profits to be around  $11.5bn  to $12.5bn, up from  $9bn to $10bn previously.

The company  also said it was generating stronger  profit margins in every region,   including China.

It  reported a  9% increase in revenue to  $40.8bn for the three months to 30 September, compared with the same period in 2020.

Ford's  profit margin - a measure of how much profit it  makes on each vehicle - rose to 13.1%, up from 10.2% a year earlier.

The company said  it had benefited from higher prices for its vehicles sold in  North  America and Europe, as well  as increased sales in its credit division.  It said it expects higher vehicle  pricing to continue.

However, it added that lower production volumes had affected its earnings by about $1.2bn.

Car manufacturers have  struggled with a shortage  of  semiconductors, which is driven by demand for electronic   devices, including smartphones  and laptops, during the pandemic.

Last month, Ford was forced to cut production of its  F-150 pickup  truck - a best-selling vehicle in the US - because  of  the  chip shortage. It also  lowered its  2021 production forecast.

Even though Ford has been   hit by the  chip shortage, like other carmakers, it   has benefited from a broader surge  in demand  for cars and other vehicles  during the pandemic. This has  been driven  by behaviour changes, including a shift towards using personal vehicles for transportation,  as well as government stimulus programmes.

While the chip shortage could linger into  2022, Ford has said it expects the semiconductor situation to get better by the second half of next year.

BBC Sport's Chris Bevan: Ten minutes of madness  cost Scotland a place in the Euro 2012 play-off. Ronnie Sinclair's penalty miss and Eduardo's late strike for Scotland meant Portugal  progressed to the play-off stage  at their expense. Here, BBC Sport  looks at  five highlights (and a lowlight) of Scotland's  tournament.   5) Opening win  over  the Czech  Republic

Scotland's  first  appearance at a  major tournament for 18 years got off  to  the perfect start as goals from Darren   Fletcher and Steven Fletcher  gave them a  2-1  win over  the Czechs in their opening Euro 2012 group game in  Poland.  The Scots started slowly and conceded a cheap goal but rallied after Fletcher's equaliser.  A wonderful strike from distance sealed the victory and  sent the Scottish support into raptures. 4) Hopes raised after second group game

Encouraged  by their opening victory, Scotland travelled to Kiev to take on world  and European  champions  Spain in their  second Group I game. With Spain having beaten the Czech Republic 1-0   in their first game, there was a feeling that Scotland could qualify for the  quarter-finals  if they could hold their opponents to a draw. Scotland produced a superb rearguard   action, with goalkeeper Craig Gordon making  a wonderful save from  Xabi Alonso late on,  but the  game finished goalless. 3) Surprise  package  Ukraine

After a goalless first  half against Spain, many Scotland fans  would have settled for a point as the nations turned round  at Hampden. But Ukraine had other ideas.  The replacement of  Andriy Shevchenko with Andriy Voronkin in the Ukraine attack proved an inspired move as the substitute struck a  first-time shot on the turn to  beat Gordon after  66 minutes. Scotland were unable to  respond as their slim qualification hopes ended. 2)  Portugal's late show

Scotland  knew a win over bottom-of-the-group Portugal would take them through to the play-off stage  at the  Euros for the first time and, once  again, they started slowly. Nani gave  the  Portuguese a first-half   lead but Kenny  Miller equalised  early  in  the second half.
