Cappuccino Cookies

Ingredients 
1 cup all-purpose flour
1  cup granulated sugar
3 tablespoons coffee granules
1 teaspoon  baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/4  teaspoon  salt
1 1/2 sticks (12  tablespoons) unsalted butter, melted
3 large eggs
2 cups  (12  oz.)  semisweet chocolate chips

For the Frosting
6 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature
1/2 cup semisweet chocolate chips
1/4 cup plus  1 1/2 tablespoons evaporated milk
1 1/2 cups confectioners' sugar
1 teaspoon  vanilla extract

Instructions
Preheat  the oven to  350 degrees F (175 degrees  C).  Line a baking sheet with  parchment  paper.
In a large bowl,  combine the flour, 3/4 cup granulated sugar, coffee granules, baking powder, baking soda and salt. In a separate bowl, whisk together the melted butter, eggs  and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients,  then fold in  the chocolate chips.
Roll the dough into 1 1/4-inch balls  and place on the prepared  baking sheet. Flatten the balls with the buttered bottom of a  glass.
Bake   in the preheated oven  until the  edges  are dry and the  centers are still slightly soft,  8 to 10  minutes. Let cool  on the baking sheets for 5  minutes, then remove to wire   racks to  cool completely.
For the frosting:  Melt the chocolate chips  with the butter in  a saucepan  over low  heat, stirring  frequently. Stir in the evaporated milk, confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract until smooth. Frost the cookies  once they are completely cool.
Variations
Coffee Hazelnut Cookies: Substitute 1/2 cup skinned hazelnuts, chopped, for 1 cup of the semisweet chocolate chips.
Molasses Cappuccino   Cookies: Use light brown sugar in place of the granulated sugar,  and add  1/4 cup mild  molasses   to the wet ingredients. Use cinnamon chips or semisweet chocolate chips  instead of all chocolate  chips.

The recipe for Triple Chocolate Mousse Cake  on allrecipes.com appears to be a  typo-laden disaster,  but I believe I've decoded it correctly.

Ingredients:

1 cup milk
1 cup flour
1 cup sugar
3  tablespoons cocoa  powder
1/2 cup butter
1/2 cup chopped nuts
1 cup melted chocolate
1/2 cup powdered sugar
1/2 cup chocolate syrup
1 cup  heavy  cream
1/4 cup sugar

Instructions
1. Preheat oven  to 350 degrees F (175  degrees C).
2. In a  small saucepan, heat milk over low  heat until just warm. Add flour, sugar,  cocoa powder, and butter;  stir until butter is  melted. Remove from heat  and stir in nuts. Pour into a 9-inch round  cake pan.
3. Bake in the preheated oven for  25  minutes. Let cool briefly, then  turn out onto a serving plate.
4. In a small bowl,  combine melted chocolate, powdered sugar, and chocolate   syrup. Stir in heavy cream. Spread over cake.
5. To serve, slice with a wet knife.  Store in refrigerator. 

This cake has three layers of   chocolate - a cake  layer at the bottom, a  mousse layer in the middle, and a frosting layer on top.  It is important  to note that   the cake should be stored   in the refrigerator  due to the  high  fat content of  the cake and mousse,  and  the milk in the cake.

Ingredients:

• 1  lb duck meat, trimmed and  finely diced
• 2 tsp soy sauce
• 1 tsp Chinese wine  (or substitute sherry)
• 1 tsp cornstarch
• 1 tsp sesame oil
• 1 tsp grated  ginger
• 2 green  onions,  finely chopped
• 1 egg
•  1  package dumpling wrappers  (approximately 50  wrappers)
• 1 tbsp olive oil
•  1/2 cup chicken broth

Instructions:

1. In a  large  bowl, combine all  ingredients except  for dumpling wrappers, olive oil, and chicken  broth.  Mix well.

2.  Take a dumpling wrapper and place a small amount of the  filling in the  center. Wet  the edges of the wrapper with  water and fold  in half to form a half-moon shape. Press the  edges together to seal.

3. In  a large pan, bring olive oil to medium heat. Add dumplings in  a single layer and cook for 2-3  minutes until the bottoms are golden brown.

4. Add chicken broth to  the  pan and  cover with a lid. Cook for another 3-4 minutes until  the dumplings are cooked through.

5. Serve  with soy sauce and chili  oil for dipping.

Here is a recipe for Split Pea Soup with Roasted  Fennel  and Lobster Salad:

Ingredients:

For the split pea soup:
1 pound split peas,  rinsed and  picked  over
1 medium onion, chopped
2 medium carrots, chopped
2  stalks  of celery,  chopped
1 garlic  clove, minced
1/4 cup olive oil
1/4 cup dry white wine
4 cups chicken  or vegetable broth
1/2 teaspoon fresh  thyme leaves, chopped
1/2   teaspoon fresh marjoram or  oregano,  chopped
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon ground black  pepper

For  the  roasted  fennel:
2 medium fennel bulbs, trimmed and cut into  1/2-inch-thick  slices
1/4  cup  olive oil
1/4  teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper

For the lobster salad:
1  pound cooked  lobster  meat, chopped
1/4 cup mayonnaise
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1 tablespoon chopped fresh chives
1 tablespoon chopped fresh tarragon
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper

Instructions:
1. To  make  the split pea soup,  in a large pot, combine the  split peas,  onion, carrots, celery, garlic, olive oil, white wine, broth, thyme,  marjoram, salt, and pepper. Bring  to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the  heat  to  low, cover, and simmer until the peas are very  soft  and beginning to fall apart, about 1 hour.
2. Meanwhile, to make the   roasted fennel, preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). On a baking sheet, toss the fennel slices with the olive oil, salt,  and pepper. Roast until tender and lightly browned, about 20  minutes.
3. To make  the lobster salad, in a medium  bowl, combine the lobster meat,  mayonnaise, lemon juice, chives, tarragon,  salt, and pepper.
4. To serve, ladle the  soup into bowls and top with a  spoonful of the lobster  salad and some roasted fennel. Enjoy!

Ingredients
• 8 each  bone-in chicken thighs (about 3 ½ pounds)
• Kosher salt and  black  pepper
• 2 cups chicken  broth
• 2 cups  water
• ½  cup white vinegar
•  2 tablespoons olive oil
• 4 medium  garlic cloves, peeled  and smashed
• 1 large shallot, finely chopped  (about ¼ cup)
• Leaves from   3 sprigs fresh thyme,  plus  1  sprig
• 1 pound mustard greens, washed, dried, and torn into bite-size pieces
•  ¼ cup  heavy cream

Instructions
1. Season the chicken  with salt and pepper. In  a large bowl, combine the broth, water, vinegar, olive oil, garlic,  chopped  shallot,  and thyme  leaves; set aside.
2. In a large Dutch oven  or  heavy pot, layer the chicken thighs, greens, and thyme   sprig, alternating and  starting  and ending with the greens. Pour the broth  mixture  over the top and  press gently on the greens to submerge them.
3. Bring  the mixture to  a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the greens are wilted.
4. Transfer the chicken and greens to a platter using a   slotted spoon. Cover loosely with foil to keep warm.
5. Increase the heat to medium and bring the liquid to a boil. Cook, stirring  occasionally, until reduced  by  about half. Stir in the heavy cream   and  return to a boil. Cook, stirring, for about  2 minutes, or until   thickened. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
6. Pour the sauce  over the chicken   and greens. Serve.

Ingredients:

- 1  pound beef sirloin, trimmed and sliced against  the grain into 1/4-inch-thick  slices
- 1/2  cup low-sodium soy sauce
- 1/3  cup packed dark brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon   toasted  sesame oil
- 1 tablespoon    rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 teaspoon cornstarch
- 1/2 teaspoon crushed   red pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon ground  ginger
-  1/4 teaspoon ground white pepper
- 3/4 cup chicken broth
- 2 tablespoons  chopped green onion
-  1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro
- 1 teaspoon grated orange zest

Instructions:

1. Combine the first 9 ingredients in  a medium bowl, stirring with  a whisk.
2. Combine beef and soy sauce mixture in a zip-top  plastic bag, and marinate in the refrigerator  1 hour, turning bag occasionally.
3. Place a large nonstick skillet over  medium-high heat until hot. Add half of beef mixture, and  stir-fry 1 minute or  until  outside surface of  beef  is  no   longer pink. (Do not overcook.) Remove   from skillet. Repeat procedure with remaining  beef mixture.
4. Add broth to skillet, and bring to  a boil. Cook until reduced to 1/4 cup (about 2 minutes).
5. Return beef to skillet; stir to coat.
6. Place beef on a serving platter, and sprinkle  with   green onions, cilantro, and orange zest.

Ingredients:
1 fish head (about 1 lb/455 g) or fish bones
1 onion,  roughly chopped
3 cloves garlic, crushed
2 lemons, 1 sliced  and 1 halved
1/3 cup/10 g fresh parsley stems
1 tbsp black peppercorns
1/2  tsp  salt

Instructions:
1. In a large saucepan, combine all ingredients with 4  cups/1 liter water and bring to a boil over high heat.
2. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for  20 minutes.
3. Remove from the   heat and strain the broth through a fine-mesh strainer.
4. Use  the broth  immediately, or  let   it cool  completely  before storing it in the  refrigerator for up to 4 days or in  the freezer for up to  3 months.

Note: You can add additional ingredients to the broth, such as carrots,  celery,  or  herbs, to enhance  the  flavor.

Sure! Here is a recipe  for Cream of Mushroom Soup that I created for  you:

Ingredients:

1 pound fresh mushrooms, finely chopped
2 tablespoons butter
1/2 cup finely chopped onion
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon black  pepper
1/4 teaspoon dried thyme
1/4  teaspoon  dried marjoram
1/4 teaspoon  dried sage
2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
1/2  cup chicken broth
1/2 cup  milk
1/4 cup heavy cream
2  tablespoons dry sherry (optional)

Instructions:

1. Clean the  mushrooms by brushing off any dirt with a damp paper towel. Don't run them under water as they'll  become soggy.  Remove   the stems  and finely chop the caps.

2. Heat the butter in a  large  saucepan  over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until translucent,  about 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms, salt, pepper, thyme, marjoram,  and sage. Cook, stirring occasionally,  until the mushrooms release their liquid  and  the  liquid evaporates, about  8 minutes.

3. Stir in the flour until combined. Gradually stir in the chicken broth, then the   milk and heavy cream. Simmer  until  the soup is  thickened,  about 5 minutes.

4. Stir  in  the sherry (if  using).  Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

I hope you  enjoy this recipe! Let me know if you have any questions or  need any further assistance.

Ingredients:
* 1 pound spaghetti
* 1/2  cup all-purpose flour
* 1/2 teaspoon baking  powder
* 1/4 teaspoon salt
*  1/4 teaspoon black pepper
* 1 egg
* 2 tablespoons olive oil
* 1 1/2 cups chicken  broth
* 1/2 cup dry white  wine
* 2 cups cherry tomatoes
* 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves
*  1/2  pound boneless skinless chicken breasts cut into 1-inch cubes
* 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese

Instructions:
* Preheat oven  to  400   degrees  F (200 degrees C).
* In a  large pot of boiling salted water,  cook  spaghetti according  to   package  instructions;  drain and  set aside.
* In a medium  bowl, combine  flour, baking powder, salt, and black  pepper. In  a small bowl, whisk together  egg and 2  tablespoons water; add to flour mixture, and mix  just until a dough forms.  Knead briefly, then wrap in plastic, and let rest for 30  minutes.
* In a small bowl, whisk together   1/2 cup chicken  broth and white wine; set aside. In a food processor, puree 1 cup tomatoes and basil; set aside.
* In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil. Add  chicken; cook  until golden, about 3 minutes per side. Add wine  mixture,  and simmer until liquid is reduced by half, about 5 minutes. Add tomato puree, and  simmer for 5 more minutes. In  a  large pot of boiling salted  water, cook  spaghetti according to  package instructions;  drain  and add to skillet with chicken. Toss to combine,  and cook for 1 minute. Add remaining chicken broth, and   cook until sauce  is  thickened, about 2 minutes more. Stir in Parmesan, and season with salt and pepper.

Ingredients:
*  1 pound broccoli  rabe, rinsed and  drained
* 6 tablespoons extra virgin  olive oil
* 3  garlic cloves, peeled and  sliced
* Red pepper flakes
*  Salt

Instructions:
* In a large  skillet over medium-high heat, heat the olive  oil
* Add  the garlic and cook until golden, about  1 minute
* Add the  broccoli rabe and cook, stirring, until beginning to soften, about  2 minutes
* Season with salt and red pepper flakes  to taste
* Cover and cook until the broccoli is tender,  about 5 minutes
*  Remove the cover  and cook off any excess liquid
* Serve  immediately

Ingredients:

- 1/2 pound fresh scallops (about 8   scallops)
-  1/2 cup heavy cream
- 1/4 cup white wine
-  2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley
-  1 tablespoon chopped fresh chives
- 1 tablespoon  butter
- 1/2  teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 4 slices bread
- 2  tablespoons olive oil
- 1/2 cup   grated Parmesan cheese, divided

Instructions:

1. Prepare the  bechamel sauce by first melting the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add  the flour and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring  occasionally. Slowly whisk in the heavy  cream and cook   until the sauce is thickened. Remove  from heat  and set aside.

2.  In a separate pan, heat the  olive oil over medium-high heat.  Add the scallops and cook  until golden brown on both  sides, about   2-3 minutes per  side. Remove    from heat and set  aside.

3. In the same pan used for the scallops, add the white wine, lemon juice, parsley, chives, salt, and black  pepper.  Cook over medium heat for about 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.

4. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).

5.  Place the bread slices  on  a baking sheet and toast in the oven  for 5-7 minutes,  or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and set aside.

6. Assemble  the coquilles by   placing a scallop on top of  each  bread slice. Pour the bechamel sauce over the scallops, then  pour  the wine  and lemon mixture over the top. Sprinkle with  Parmesan cheese.

7. Bake the   coquilles for 5-7 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

8. Serve immediately and enjoy!

Ingredients:

1 lb. ground chicken
1/2 cup   chopped fresh bell peppers
1/2 cup chopped onion
1/4 cup  chopped fresh cilantro
1 tsp. minced  garlic
1 tsp.  paprika
1/2 tsp. ground cumin
1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. cayenne pepper
4 burger buns, split

Instructions:

1. In  a large bowl, combine the first eight ingredients. Shape into  four burgers.
2. Grill, covered,  over medium heat  for 6-8 minutes on each side   or  until a thermometer  reads 165°.
3. Serve on buns.

Ingredients:
1 cup sliced carrots
1  cup frozen green peas
1/2 cup finely  chopped  onion
1/2 cup butter
1/2 cup all-purpose  flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon black pepper
1 3/4 cups chicken   broth
3/4  cup milk
1  1/2  cups chopped cooked chicken
1  cup sliced fresh mushrooms
2 cups cooked egg noodles

Instructions:
1. Preheat  oven to  350 degrees F  (175 degrees C).
2. In a large saucepan, bring water to a boil. Add  carrots and peas, and cook until  tender, about 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.
3. In  the same saucepan,  cook and stir onion in butter   over medium heat  until tender, about  5 minutes. Stir in flour,  salt, and pepper. Cook for 2 minutes. Gradually  stir in chicken broth and milk. Cook, stirring, until sauce is thickened and bubbly.
4. Stir in chicken, mushrooms, carrots, and peas.  Cover and  bake  for 20 minutes.
5. Stir in  cooked egg noodles and bake, uncovered,  for 10 minutes more.

Ingredients
4 duck legs,  excess fat and skin removed, rinsed and  patted dry
1 tsp dried oregano
1/2  cup pitted kalamata olives
1/2 cup chicken stock
2 tbsp  chopped fresh  parsley

Instructions
1.  In   a bowl, combine the  duck legs,  oregano, 1/4 cup of the olives, and 1/4 cup of  the chicken stock. Marinate in  the  refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
2. Preheat the oven  to 425°F (220°C).
3. Transfer the duck legs and marinade to a baking dish. Bake for  30-35  minutes, or until the duck is cooked  through and the juices  run clear.
4. Transfer the duck legs to a plate and keep  warm.
5. Pour  the remaining chicken stock and olives into the baking dish.  Return to   the oven and bake for an additional 5  minutes, or until the olives are heated through.
6. Stir in the parsley.
7. Serve  the duck legs with the  olive  sauce.

1 1/2   cups almond flour (or other whole-wheat flour)

3  tablespoons coconut oil, melted

1 teaspoon  baking  powder

1  tablespoon vanilla  extract

1  cup powdered sugar

1 egg

1/4 cup coconut milk

1/8 teaspoon salt

Preheat oven to 350 degrees  F. Grease and flour two 9″ round cake pans. In a large bowl, whisk together  the almond flour, coconut oil, baking powder, vanilla extract, and powdered   sugar until well combined. Add in the egg and  mix until  just combined. Stir in  the  coconut milk and salt. Pour batter into prepared pan(s). Bake for 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted  comes out clean. Let  cool completely before frosting.

I made  these donuts with my KitchenAid  stand mixer. I used the dough hook attachment on  the machine to knead the dough for  about 5  minutes. The dough was very sticky but not too hard to work with. After that,  I  added  the coconut  milk and  salt and mixed it up again. Then I added the egg and beat it until smooth. It took me  about 3 more  minutes to get the dough to come together. Once it did,  I  rolled  it out onto parchment paper and cut it  into rounds. I then placed them   on a  sheet  pan  lined  with waxed paper. I let them sit at room  temperature  for an  hour before  frosting.

These are  delicious! They were moist and soft and tasted like they had been baked in the oven. I would  definitely make  this again.

Instructions:

Ingredients (for 6 servings)

2 1/4 pound  ground beef

1 small onion, finely chopped

6 ribs  celery sliced thinly

3 bay  leaves

1 medium potato, peeled and cubed

2 large carrots cut into  ½ inch pieces

2 stalks celery, coarsely shredded (optional)

2 tablespoons dry taco seasoning mix

Pinch of cayenne pepper ("add in to spice mix if  you   can't  bear it")

Salt & freshly ground black pepper

Directions

Brown meat in a small saucepan or  skillet over low heat until no longer  pink.

Meanwhile, chop onions,  carrots and celery into  bite-size pieces.  Set  aside.

In the same large   pot  with meat, cook remaining ingredients on high while stirring occasionally until potatoes are fork tender. Add  seasonings after the meat  has  cooked through.

Serve with homemade  "Texas Toast", sour  cream,  chopped black  olives, crackers, apple cider vinegar,  and more grated cheese for serving!
"Carbonara  is a tomato-based Italian  dish that's a dish made with    pasta (usually linguine), but with a topping of cream and lots of green vegetables. It's usually topped with mozzarella cheese.

Melt butter in a large pot with potatoes and cook until  translucent. Add your broccoli at this time to  prevent splashing  and cooking the  broccoli in its  own liquid,  while you mix  your cheese sauce that  was simmering. After about 45 minutes start the gravy and add salt & pepper,  garlic powder,  parsley to taste. Cook  10 more minutes on low heat or until desired  consistency. Enjoy!

Potato gnocchi are one of my  favorite comfort foods, and  I've  made them many times over the years. They're easy to make,  and they taste  great! This basic potato gnocchi  recipe makes enough  for two people, but you  can  easily  double or triple it if you like.  You'll need about 1  pound of potatoes (about 4 medium-sized ones), 2 cups of water, salt, and pepper. Bring the water  to a boil in a  large pot, then add the potatoes and cook until tender, about  10 minutes. Drain the  potatoes and set  aside.  In a small bowl, whisk together  the  flour, baking powder, and salt. Add the  butter  and stir until  smooth. Whisk in  the milk and continue  stirring until combined.  Stir in the grated  cheese until well incorporated. Pour the mixture into a greased 9×13 inch casserole dish. Bake  at 350  degrees F for 30 minutes,  or until  golden brown on top. Let cool slightly before serving.

Ingredients:

1  pound ground beef (or turkey)

2  cups shredded  mozzarella cheese,  divided

3 eggs

1 cup milk

½ teaspoon salt

¼ teaspoon pepper

1 tablespoon flour

1  ½ teaspoons dried parsley flakes

Directions:

Preheat oven  to 350  degrees F. In a large bowl combine meat and cheese. Mix well with your  hands  until  thoroughly combined. Add egg, milk, salt,  pepper, and flour; mix  well. Form into 8 patties or 9 mini quiches. Bake  in preheated  oven for 20 minutes. Remove from  oven and  let cool on wire rack. Serve warm.

Ingredients:

1 pound  pork  chops, cut   into 1-inch cubes

2 tablespoons olive oil

3/4 cup apple cider vinegar

1 tablespoon honey

1  teaspoon salt

1/8 teaspoon black pepper

1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg

1/4 teaspoon cinnamon

Directions:

Heat oven to 350 degrees F.  Place  pork in a large roasting pan or baking sheet. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons of olive oil; season  with salt and pepper. Roast until  browned  on   both sides, about 45 minutes. Remove from  oven  and set aside. In a small bowl combine  vinegar, honey, salt,  pepper, nutmeg, and cinnamon.  Pour over  pork. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes. Serve warm.

Ingredients:

1  pound quail,  skin  on (about 4-5 pounds)

2  tablespoons olive oil

Salt and pepper to taste

Directions:

Preheat oven to  400 degrees F. Season quail with salt  and pepper. Place in a roasting pan or baking sheet lined with foil. Drizzle with  2 tablespoons olive oil. Bake until cooked through, about 20 minutes.  Serve hot.

How to Make  Death by Chocolate: Cocoa Pudding Death was never the easiest dish to prepare when it   first became popular due, in part, to its  unusual  presentation on the   menu. The first major alteration was made during chocolate's heyday in the latter  half of the 19th century as well as after  World War  I and, even today,  chocolate pudding  can often be found  with extra fat added. Once fat has  been added, however, death actually appears very simple. In fact, if you want one step easier, here are  my only two suggestions (these last are optional). One would make this dish for children. After the fat  has been poured over the top of the cake mixture, using  an instant pudding mix like Jello (like I recommend), whip each portion  until smooth with  the back  of your  spoon. Place them into small pudding cups with  lids, or  just use ziplock bags  and place in   a freezer baggie to keep them frozen. (Remember  to shake every so often  to  prevent settling.) You  know I'm serious about  the ice cubes. After  the death by  chocolate batter  is whipped into thick meringues, divide between 24 individual dessert trays. Put some fresh raspberries and strawberries in one tray  or   serve  alongside. If desired, sprinkle  with finely chopped cocoa powder. Top the   serving  dishes, with  a few pieces  of parchment paper, with   whipped cream, fresh berries, chocolate sauce etcetera." Ingredients:

1  large     tomato, peeled and diced

2  cloves garlic, minced

3 tablespoons olive oil

1/4 cup red wine  vinegar

1 tablespoon dried oregano

1 teaspoon salt

1/8 teaspoon black pepper

Directions:

In a medium saucepan over  low heat, combine tomatoes with garlic,  olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano,  salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, reduce  heat  to low and simmer  until thickened, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool slightly before serving.

Ingredients:
1 pound ground duck
1/2 cup chopped onion
1/4 cup chopped celery
1/4 cup chopped green bell pepper
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon black pepper
1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed   cream  of  chicken soup
1/2 cup water
1 (12  ounce) package frozen mixed vegetables
1 (14.1 ounce) package refrigerated  buttermilk biscuits

Instructions:
1.  Preheat  oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
2. In a large bowl, mix  together ground duck, onion, celery, green  bell  pepper, flour, salt, and black pepper.
3. In  a small bowl, whisk together cream  of chicken soup and water. Pour over duck  mixture, and mix  well.
4. Stir in  frozen mixed vegetables.
5. Grease a 9x13  inch baking dish. Separate biscuits,  and place on top of duck mixture.
6.  Bake for 20  minutes, or  until biscuits  are golden  brown.

Ingredients:

1 lb. dried  split peas, soaked overnight

1  large fennel bulb, diced

1 small onion,   diced

3 cloves garlic, minced

4 cups chicken or  vegetable stock

2 bay leaves

1/2 teaspoon  dried  thyme

Salt and  black pepper to taste

1  (1 lb.) lobster   tail, cooked  and diced

1/2  cup mayonnaise

1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice

Ground cayenne pepper to taste

1 head Boston lettuce, shredded

1/4  cup chopped fresh parsley

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

2. In a large pot,  combine split peas, fennel, onion,  garlic, chicken stock, bay leaves, thyme,  salt, and black pepper. Bring to  a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer  for 1 1/2 hours, or until split  peas are very soft.

3. Remove from heat, and   discard bay  leaves. Puree soup in a  blender  or food processor, and return to pot.

4.  In a  small bowl,  combine lobster, mayonnaise, lemon juice, and cayenne pepper.

5. To serve, ladle soup into individual bowls, and top  with lobster salad and   shredded lettuce. Sprinkle with chopped parsley.

Ingredients:

1 (3-pound)  chicken, cut into 8 pieces

Salt and freshly ground black pepper

1/4 cup all-purpose  flour

2 tablespoons olive  oil

1 large  onion, halved and sliced

1/2 cup chicken broth

1/2  cup white vinegar

1/4 cup honey

1 teaspoon  dried thyme

1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper

1/2 pound  greens (such as Swiss chard, kale, or collards), tough stems removed, leaves chopped

Directions:

1. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour, shaking off any excess.

2. In   a large  Dutch oven or other  heavy pot,  heat oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned, about 5 minutes per side.

3. Add onion and  cook until  softened, about    5 minutes.

4. Add chicken broth, vinegar, honey, thyme, and cayenne, and bring to a  boil.

5.  Add greens and cook until wilted, about  5  minutes.

6. Reduce heat to low and  simmer, covered, until chicken is cooked through  and sauce is thickened, about   30 minutes.

7. Serve  over  cooked rice or other   grain.

Ingredients:

1 pound beef sirloin, cut  into thin strips

1/2 cup all-purpose flour

2 tablespoons cornstarch

1  teaspoon salt

1/2 teaspoon baking soda

1/4 teaspoon black  pepper

1/4  cup  vegetable oil

1/2 cup orange juice

1/4 cup light  soy sauce

1  tablespoon rice  vinegar

1 tablespoon  sugar

1 tablespoon ketchup

1 tablespoon chili paste with garlic

1 teaspoon grated orange peel

Directions:

1. In a large resealable plastic bag, combine flour,  cornstarch, salt, baking soda and pepper.  Add beef strips,  a few at a  time, and shake to coat.

2. In  a  large skillet or wok, heat  oil over medium-high  heat. Add beef strips;  stir-fry for 3-4 minutes   or until beef is no longer pink.   Remove  and drain on paper towels.

3.  In a small saucepan,  combine the orange juice, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, ketchup, chili paste and orange peel. Bring to a boil.

4. Add beef strips;  cook and stir for 2-3 minutes or until sauce  is  thickened.

Ingredients:

1 tablespoon olive  oil

1 onion,  chopped

3 cloves garlic,  minced

1  carrot, chopped

1 celery   stalk, chopped

1/2 teaspoon dried  thyme

1/2 teaspoon dried basil

1/4 teaspoon dried oregano

1/4 teaspoon dried  rosemary

1 bay leaf

1/2 cup white wine

4 cups chicken broth

1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes, undrained

1 (8 ounce) can tomato   sauce

1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley

1/4 cup chopped fresh basil

1/2 teaspoon salt

1/4 teaspoon black pepper

1 pound cod fillets,  cut into 1-inch pieces

1/4 cup all-purpose flour

2 tablespoons olive oil

1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese

Directions:

In a large saucepan, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil  over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, carrot, celery, thyme, basil, oregano, rosemary,   and bay leaf; cook and stir  until vegetables  are tender,  about 10 minutes.

Stir  in wine,  chicken   broth,   diced tomatoes with their juice, tomato  sauce, parsley, basil, salt, and black pepper. Bring to  a  boil; reduce heat to low and simmer for  30 minutes.

Meanwhile,  in a shallow bowl, toss cod pieces  with flour. In a  large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium-high heat. Add cod; cook and stir until  fish is  opaque, about  3  minutes.

Remove bay leaf from  soup. Stir in cod and Parmesan cheese. Cook just  until heated through,  about 5 minutes.

Ingredients:
1  cup sliced fresh mushrooms
1/4 cup chopped onion
1 tablespoon butter
1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
1/2  teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon  ground black pepper
2 cups chicken broth
3/4 cup milk
1/4 cup sour cream
Directions:

1. In  a  large saucepan, cook mushrooms, onion, and butter  over medium heat until   tender.

2. Stir  in flour, salt, and  pepper; gradually add chicken broth and  milk. Bring  to a boil, stirring constantly; cook and stir for 2 minutes more.

3. Remove  from heat; stir in  sour cream.

Ingredients:

1 pound  spaghetti

1 tablespoons olive oil

4 chicken breasts,  boneless  and skinless

Salt and   pepper

1/2 cup all-purpose flour

2  tablespoons butter

1  1/2 cups   cherry tomatoes

1/4 cup chicken broth

1/4 cup  heavy cream

1 teaspoon sugar

1/4 teaspoon salt

1/4 teaspoon black  pepper

1 tablespoon chopped fresh  parsley

Directions:

1. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.

2.  While  pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.  Season chicken breasts with salt and  pepper, then dredge in flour.

3. Add chicken to the skillet  and cook until   browned and  cooked through, about 4 minutes per side.

4. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.

5.  In the same skillet, melt butter  over  medium heat. Add cherry tomatoes and  cook until they begin  to soften, about 2 minutes.

6. Add chicken broth, heavy cream, sugar, salt, and black pepper to the skillet and cook  until  sauce is slightly thickened, about 2 minutes.

7. Return chicken to  the skillet  and cook until heated  through, about 1 minute.

8. Serve chicken and sauce over cooked  spaghetti. Garnish  with chopped parsley.

Ingredients:
1 bunch  broccoli rabe, trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces
1/4 cup olive oil
4 cloves garlic, minced
1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper  flakes
1/4 cup freshly  grated Parmesan  cheese
Salt  and pepper to   taste

Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190  degrees  C).
2. Toss broccoli rabe with olive oil, garlic, red pepper flakes,  Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
3.  Spread broccoli rabe  onto a baking sheet.
4. Bake for 10 minutes, or until tender.

Ingredients

1/4 cup all-purpose flour
3 tablespoons butter
1/2  cup dry  white  wine
1/2 cup chicken  broth
1/4  teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon  dried thyme
1/8 teaspoon white pepper
4   green onions, thinly sliced
1 pound fresh scallops
1/2 cup shredded Swiss cheese
1/4  cup dry bread crumbs
1 tablespoon  butter, melted

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees  F (200 degrees C).

2.  In a small saucepan, whisk together flour and 3 tablespoons butter over low heat until  smooth. Stir in wine,  chicken broth, salt, thyme, and white pepper.  Bring to a simmer,  and cook until  thickened.

3. In a large baking dish, combine green onions, scallops, Swiss cheese,  and bread crumbs.  Pour the sauce over the scallop mixture, and stir to  combine. Dot with   1 tablespoon  melted butter.

4. Bake for 20 minutes, or until the top is golden brown  and  the sauce is bubbling.

Ingredients:

1 lb ground chicken

1 red bell   pepper, chopped

1 green  bell pepper,  chopped

1/2 onion, chopped

1/4  cup chopped  cilantro

1  egg

1 tablespoon olive oil

1 tablespoon garlic powder

1/2 teaspoon salt

1/4  teaspoon  black pepper

Instructions:

1. In a large bowl, mix together ground chicken, bell  peppers, onion, cilantro,  egg, olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.

2. Shape mixture into 4 burgers.

3. Grill burgers  over medium-high  heat for about 10 minutes, or until cooked through.

4. Serve on  hamburger buns with your favorite toppings.

Ingredients

1 lb.  chicken breast, cooked and shredded

8 oz. wide egg noodles

1 (10.75 oz) can condensed cream of chicken soup

1/2 cup  milk

1/4 tsp. black pepper

Instructions

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees  F (175  degrees C).

2. In a large pot of boiling water, cook egg noodles according to package   instructions.

3. In a large bowl, combine cooked  and shredded chicken,  egg noodles, cream of chicken soup, milk, and  black  pepper.

4. Pour  mixture into a 9x13 inch  baking dish.

5. Bake  for 30 minutes    or until heated through.

Ingredients for Duck  Dumplings:

For the Filling:
- 1 whole duck
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1  teaspoon Chinese five-spice powder
- 1  teaspoon sugar 
- 1/4  cup hoisin sauce
-  2 green onions,  finely chopped
- 1/2 cup diced water chestnuts
- 1  garlic clove, minced
- 1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger

For the Dumplings:
- 40 dumpling wrappers
- Small bowl of  water, for assembling dumplings
-  canola oil, for frying

For the Dipping sauce:
- 1/2 cup soy sauce
- 1/4 cup rice vinegar
- 2  teaspoons  sesame oil
- 1 teaspoon sugar 
- 1  green onion,  chopped

Instructions:

1. Preheat  your oven to 350°F (175°C).  Place  the duck   on a rack in a roasting  pan and season with soy  sauce, sugar, and Chinese five-spice. Roast the   duck in  the  oven for about 2 hours or until  the internal temperature reaches   165°F  (75°C).

2. While the duck is roasting, prepare the dipping sauce  by  whisking together soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, sugar and chopped green onion in a small bowl. Set aside.

3. When  the  duck  is done, remove  it from oven and set aside until  cool enough to handle. Shred the duck meat, discarding the skin  and bones.

4. In a large bowl, combine  shredded duck meat, hoisin  sauce, chopped  green onions, diced water chestnuts, minced garlic and grated ginger. Stir until well combined.

5. Lay out the dumpling wrappers out  on  a clean work  surface. Scoop about 1 tablespoon of the  duck  mixture onto  the center of each wrapper.

6. Dip your finger in the bowl of water and run it around the edge  of each dumpling wrapper. Fold the  wrapper over the filling  to create   a semi-circle, and press the edges together  to seal.

7. Heat a large pan over medium  heat and add  a little bit  of oil. Add the dumplings  in batches, ensuring they  don’t touch  each other, and pan-fry until the bottoms  are golden brown,  about 3-4 minutes.

8. Add a   few tablespoons of water  to  the pan, cover and let dumplings steam for another 2 minutes or until the water has evaporated.  Repeat with remaining dumplings.

9.  Serve duck dumplings   hot  with the dipping  sauce.

Ingredients for Split Pea Soup:

1. 1 1/2   cups  dried split peas
2. 1 tablespoon olive oil
3. 1  white onion, chopped
4. 1 fennel bulb, chopped (fronds  set  aside)
5. 2 cloves garlic, minced
6.  7 cups  vegetable broth
7. Salt and black pepper to taste

Ingredients for Roasted Fennel:
1.  2  fennel bulbs, cut into quarters
2. 2 tablespoons  olive  oil
3. Salt and pepper  to taste

Ingredients for Lobster Salad:
1. 1 lb cooked lobster meat,   diced
2. 3 tablespoons mayonnaise
3.  1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
4. 2  stalks of celery,  finely chopped
5. Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

1. Start by preheating your oven  to 400°F (200°C) for the roasted  fennel.

2. To  make the split pea soup, heat oil  in a large pot or  dutch oven over medium heat.

3.   Add the onion, chopped fennel, and garlic. Sauté until softened, about  10 minutes.

4. Add split peas and vegetable broth, bring  to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, until  peas are  soft, usually for about one hour.

5. While the soup is simmering, prepare the  roasted fennel. Toss fennel  quarters in olive oil, salt,  and pepper. Spread out on a  foil-lined baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes until  tender and  caramelized.

6.  To make the   lobster salad,  combine the diced lobster, mayonnaise, lemon juice, celery, salt, and pepper -  mixing  well. Refrigerate until needed.

7. When the  split peas are  soft,  use an immersion  blender  to puree the soup until smooth. Add seasoning as needed.

8. To serve,  ladle the soup into bowls, top with a spoonful  of lobster salad and a   piece of roasted fennel. 

Enjoy this comfort dish packed with  exciting flavors and textures!

Ingredients:

-  4 chicken thighs
- 4 chicken drumsticks
- Salt and Pepper to taste
- 3 tablespoons olive  oil
-  1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 3 garlic cloves, finely chopped
- 1  tablespoon tomato paste
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup red wine vinegar
- 4 cups low-sodium chicken broth
- 1 bay leaf
- 1  bunch of mixed greens  (such  as kale  and collards), ribs and stems removed,  leaves cut  into  bite-size pieces
- Fresh parsley for garnish 

Instructions:

1. Season chicken with salt and   pepper. 

2. In a large,  heavy pot or  Dutch  oven, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken, skin side down, and cook until browned, about 5  minutes on each side.  Transfer the chicken to  a  plate.

3. Reduce heat to medium. Add the onions into the pot and cook,  stirring occasionally,  until golden brown, about 8-10  minutes.

4. Add  the garlic and cook for another 2  minutes, stirring continuously to avoid burning. 

5.  Add the tomato paste  and flour into the pot  and stir for  about a minute until a thick paste forms. 

6. Stir in vinegar, then   add broth,  bay leaf  and chicken  with any accumulated juices. Bring to  a boil, reduce heat, and  partially cover. Let it simmer until chicken is cooked through,  about 40-50  minutes.

7. Add mixed  greens to pot and cook, stirring, until  wilted, about 5-7 minutes. Season with more  salt and  pepper, if desired.

8. Garnish with  fresh parsley and  serve with crusty bread, if you like.  Enjoy  your Vinegar-Braised Chicken With Greens.

SZECHUAN CRISPY ORANGE BEEF RECIPE

Ingredients:

- 1 pound boneless beef  steak, (sirloin or tenderloin),  thinly sliced
- 2 oranges,  zest and juice
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 1/4 cup white vinegar
- 1/4  cup granulated white sugar
- 1 tbsp  cornstarch
- 1 tsp  Szechuan pepper, crushed
- 2 cloves   garlic, minced
- 1 tbsp fresh ginger,  minced
- 2 cups vegetable  oil for frying
- 1/2 cup cornstarch for dredging
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 4 green  onions, sliced
- 1 tsp red pepper flakes (optional for added  heat)

Instructions:

1. In a bowl, combine soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, orange juice, and  orange zest. Stir  until sugar  is completely dissolved.

2. Take half of this mixture and marinate the thinly  sliced beef in it for  at least one hour, covered  in the refrigerator.

3. Mix 1    tbsp cornstarch into the remaining sauce,  stir well and  set   aside.

4. Drain the beef from  the marinade and pat   dry. Dredge  each  piece in  cornstarch, ensuring each piece is thoroughly coated.

5. Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or deep skillet  over  high heat. Once  hot  but not smoking, add the beef slices  and fry them until they are crispy and  golden brown.  Do not overload the pan, you  may need to do this in batches.

6. Remove the  crispy beef slices  using a slotted  spoon and place them on a paper  towel    to get rid of excess oil.

7. In a separate pan, sauté minced garlic, ginger, and crushed Szechuan pepper for about  1 minute over medium heat or   until fragrant.

8. Add  the  sliced bell peppers to the  pan and  stir-fry for a minute.

9. Pour the remainder  of the orange sauce into the  pan and let it simmer. The sauce should thicken because of the  cornstarch.

10. Once the  sauce is thickened, add  the crispy beef,  sliced green onions, and red pepper   flakes (if using).  Toss  all these  together until the beef is coated with sauce.

11. Serve your Szechuan Crispy Orange Beef hot with a side of steamed rice or noodles.

Enjoy your spicy, tangy, and  crispy Szechuan dish!

Recipe  for Fish  Broth:

Ingredients:

1. 1 lb fish  bones or fish head
2. 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 
3. 2 onions - chopped 
4. 2 carrots - chopped 
5. 2 sticks celery - chopped 
6. 3  cloves garlic - chopped 
7. 1 cup  dry white wine 
8. 2  quarts water  
9. 1-2 bay leaves  
10. 1 teaspoon black peppercorns 
11. A bunch of fresh parsley
12. Salt to taste

Instructions:

1. Rinse the fish bones or head under cold water. Make sure to remove any  blood, as it  can make  your broth cloudy.

2. Heat the vegetable oil in  a large pot over medium heat. Add in  the onions, carrots, celery, and garlic,  and sauté them for about 3-4 minutes or   until they start to soften.

3. Once the  vegetables  are soft, add  in the fish  bones or  fish head to the pot and stir well.  Allow it to cook with the vegetables for another  3-4 minutes.

4. After the fish and vegetables have cooked together, pour in  the white wine  and  turn up the heat  to bring it  to a simmer. Let  it simmer for about 2-3 minutes to allow the alcohol to evaporate.

5. Then add the fresh water, parsley,  black peppercorns, and  bay leaves to the pot.  Bring  the mixture to    a boil. 

6. Reduce the heat to  low  to  maintain a gentle   simmer. Cover the pot but  leave the lid ajar slightly. Let it simmer for about 2.5-3 hours. 

7.  Skim off any foam that rises to the surface periodically during the simmering process.

8. After  it  has  simmered, strain your fish broth through a fine mesh strainer into another pot  or  container. Discard the solids.

9. Taste  the broth and add salt, if needed.  

10.  Use  your homemade fish  broth immediately, or let  it cool  then store it in  a sealed container in  your refrigerator for up  to  1 week, or freeze for up to 6 months. 

This fish broth  can  be  used as  the base for many different soup, chowder and stew recipes, or you could simply enjoy it hot with   a bit of fresh chopped  parsley   on top. Enjoy!

Ingredients:

- 2  lamb shanks
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
-  1 large onion, chopped
- 2 cloves  garlic,  minced
- 2  carrots, chopped
- 2 celery stalks, chopped
- 1 cup  red  wine
- 4 cups beef broth
- 1  can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes
- 2 bay leaves
- 1 teaspoon dried rosemary
- 1  teaspoon dried thyme
- Salt and pepper to  taste
- 2 potatoes, peeled and  chopped
- Fresh   parsley for garnish

Instructions:

1. Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Season the lamb shanks with salt and pepper, then add them to the pot. Cook until   browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the lamb from the pot  and set aside.

2. In the same pot, add  the chopped onion, garlic, carrots, and celery. Cook until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.

3. Pour in the red wine, scraping the bottom  of the pot  to loosen any browned bits. Let the wine  simmer  for a few minutes until it reduces slightly.

4. Add the  beef broth, diced tomatoes, bay  leaves, rosemary, and thyme to the pot. Stir well to combine.

5. Return the lamb   shanks  to the pot,  nestling them into the  liquid and vegetables. Bring the stew to a simmer,  then reduce the heat to   low, cover  the pot,  and let  it  simmer  for about 2 hours.

6. After 2 hours,  add  the chopped potatoes to  the  pot. Cover and continue  to  simmer  for another hour, or until the lamb  is tender and the potatoes are cooked through.

7.  Once the lamb  is cooked, remove the bay leaves. Taste  the stew and adjust  the seasoning with more  salt and  pepper if needed.

8. Serve the   lamb  shank stew hot, garnished  with fresh parsley. Enjoy  this hearty and comforting  dish with a side of crusty bread  or over mashed potatoes for a  complete meal.

Ingredients:

For the  Crust:
-    2 cups almond  flour
- 1/4 cup coconut oil, melted
- 1 tablespoon   honey
- 1/2 teaspoon  vanilla  extract
- 1/4 teaspoon sea salt

For  the Filling:
- 1 cup freshly  squeezed blood orange juice (about 4-5 blood oranges)
- Zest  of 2 blood oranges
- 1/2 cup  honey
- 3 large eggs
-  1/2 cup coconut milk
- 1/4 cup coconut  oil
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon sea salt

Instructions:

1. Preheat your oven  to 350°F (175°C). 

2.  In  a medium  bowl, combine  the almond flour, melted coconut  oil, honey, vanilla extract, and sea salt. Stir until well combined.

3.  Press the  mixture  into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch tart  pan. Bake for 10-12  minutes, or until lightly golden. Remove from the  oven and set aside.

4. While the crust is baking, prepare the  filling. In a medium saucepan,  combine the blood orange  juice, zest, and honey. Bring to a simmer  over medium heat  and cook for about 10 minutes,  or until the  mixture has    reduced by half.

5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, coconut milk,  coconut oil,  vanilla extract, and sea salt. Slowly pour  the hot orange mixture into the egg mixture, whisking constantly to  prevent the  eggs from scrambling.

6. Pour the   filling into the  baked crust.  Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the filling  is set and the  edges are lightly golden.

7. Remove the  tart  from the oven and let it  cool completely. Once cooled, refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

8. Serve chilled, garnished with additional blood orange slices if desired. Enjoy your grain-free blood orange tart!

Ingredients:

- 6 Bratwurst sausages
- 12 slices of thick-cut bacon
- 1 cup of your  favorite BBQ  sauce
- 1 bag of charcoal
- 1  bag of  wood chips (preferably hickory or applewood)
-  6 hot dog buns
- Optional toppings: sauerkraut, grilled onions, mustard

Instructions:

1. Preheat your charcoal grill. Arrange the charcoal on one side of the grill to create  a hot  zone and a cooler zone.

2. While the grill   is heating, wrap each bratwurst  with  two slices of bacon. Secure  the bacon  with  toothpicks if necessary.

3. Once the  grill  is hot, add a handful of  wood  chips to the  charcoal. This will create the smoke for your brats.

4. Place  the bacon-wrapped brats  on  the cooler side of the grill. Cover the  grill and let them smoke for  about 30 minutes.

5. After  30 minutes, check the brats. The bacon should be starting to crisp  up and the brats  should be turning a nice golden brown. If they're not  quite there  yet, give them  another 10-15 minutes.

6. Once the brats are smoked, move them over to the  hot side of the grill. Brush them with your favorite BBQ sauce   and grill them for  another 2-3  minutes on each side,  until the bacon  is crispy  and the  BBQ sauce is caramelized.

7. Remove the  brats from the grill and  let  them rest for a few minutes.

8. While the  brats are resting, toast the hot  dog  buns on the grill for a minute  or two, until they're lightly  toasted.

9. Place each brat in a toasted  bun and top with your favorite toppings. Enjoy your charcoal smoked  bacon wrapped brats!

Note: Always be  careful  when handling a  hot grill. Use  long tongs and a grill mitt to  protect your hands.

Ingredients:

- 1.5 pounds  of fresh scallops
- 1  cup of  dry white wine
- 1  cup  of water
- 1 bay leaf
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 1/2 cup of finely chopped celery
- 1/2 cup of finely chopped leek
-  2 cloves  of garlic, minced
- 4  tablespoons of unsalted  butter
- 1/4 cup of all-purpose flour
- 1 cup of heavy cream
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup of  grated  Gruyère cheese
- 1/2 cup of  breadcrumbs
- Fresh   parsley  for garnish

Instructions:

1.  Preheat your oven  to 400 degrees  F (200 degrees C).

2. In a large saucepan, combine the scallops, wine, water, and bay leaf. Bring to  a simmer  over medium heat and  cook  for about 5 minutes, until the scallops  are just cooked through. 

3.  Using a  slotted spoon,  remove the scallops from the  pan  and set them aside. Reserve the cooking liquid.

4. In a large  skillet, melt 2 tablespoons of  the butter over medium heat. Add the onion,  celery, leek, and garlic, and cook  until they are  soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.

5. Stir in the flour and cook for another  2 minutes.  Gradually whisk in  the reserved   cooking liquid and the heavy cream. Bring  the  mixture to a simmer  and cook until it  thickens, about 5 minutes. Season with  salt and pepper.

6. Cut the scallops  into bite-sized pieces  and  add them to the sauce. Stir to combine.

7. Divide the scallop mixture among 4 ovenproof dishes. Sprinkle each dish with the grated Gruyère and  breadcrumbs.

8. Melt the remaining 2  tablespoons of butter  and drizzle  it over the breadcrumbs.

9. Bake in the   preheated oven for about  15 minutes, until the cheese is melted and  the breadcrumbs are golden brown.

10. Garnish with fresh parsley before serving. Enjoy your  Coquilles St. Jacques!

Note: This dish is  traditionally served in  scallop shells, but you can  also use small  gratin dishes or ramekins.

Ingredients:

- 4 large eggs
-  Salt and pepper  to taste
- 2 tablespoons of   butter
- 4   flour tortillas  (8  inches)
- 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese
- 1  cup of cooked bacon, crumbled
- 1  cup of  diced tomatoes
- 1/2 cup of diced onions
- 1/2 cup of diced  bell peppers
- 1/2 cup of salsa
- 1/2  cup of  sour cream

Instructions:

1. In a  bowl, whisk the eggs, salt, and pepper  until  well combined.
2. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and  add the  butter. Once the  butter is melted,   pour in the whisked  eggs.
3. Cook the eggs, stirring occasionally, until they  are scrambled and fully cooked. Remove the skillet from the heat and set it aside.
4. Warm the   tortillas in a  dry skillet over medium heat for  about 30 seconds on each side.
5.  Lay out the warmed  tortillas on a clean surface. Divide the scrambled eggs evenly  among  the  tortillas.
6. Top the eggs with  the shredded cheese, crumbled bacon, diced tomatoes, onions, and bell peppers.
7.  Roll up each tortilla tightly,  tucking in the sides as you go, to create a wrap.
8. Return the wraps to the skillet  and cook  for 1-2 minutes on each side, until they  are golden brown  and  crispy.
9. Serve the breakfast wraps hot,  with salsa and  sour cream on the side for dipping.

Enjoy your delicious and filling breakfast wraps!

Ingredients:

For the Chicken:
- 500 grams of boneless chicken
- 1 teaspoon of red chili powder
- 1 tablespoon  of lemon juice
- Salt to taste
- 2 tablespoons of  oil

For the Makhani Sauce:
- 2 tablespoons of butter
- 2 cloves of  garlic,  minced
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 1 can of tomato puree (400  grams)
- 1 teaspoon of red  chili powder
- 1 teaspoon of  garam masala
- 1  teaspoon of cumin powder
-   1 teaspoon  of  coriander  powder
- 1 cup  of  heavy  cream
- Salt to  taste
- 1 tablespoon of sugar
- 2 tablespoons of dried fenugreek leaves  (kasuri methi)

Instructions:

1. Marinate the  chicken with  red chili powder,  lemon juice, and salt.  Set it aside for 15-20 minutes.

2. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the marinated chicken and cook until it's fully cooked. Remove the  chicken from  the  pan and set it aside.

3.  In  the same pan, add butter.   Once it's melted, add the minced garlic and chopped onion. Sauté until the onions become translucent.

4.  Add  the tomato puree to the pan and stir well. Cook for about  5 minutes.

5. Add the red chili powder, garam masala, cumin powder, and  coriander powder to the  pan. Mix well and cook for another 2-3  minutes.

6.  Add the heavy cream,  salt, and sugar to the  pan. Stir well and   bring the mixture  to a  simmer.

7. Add the cooked  chicken to the pan and mix well, ensuring that the  chicken is fully coated with the sauce. Cook  for another 5-7  minutes.

8. Crush the  dried fenugreek leaves with your hands and sprinkle them over the chicken. Stir well and cook for another 2 minutes.

9.  Serve  the  Makhani Chicken  hot  with naan or  rice.

Enjoy your Indian Butter  Chicken!

Title: Meatloaf for Meatloaf Haters

Introduction:
Are you tired  of   the same old meatloaf recipes that are heavy, dense, and just plain boring? Do  you have a meatloaf hater in your household who refuses  to touch the stuff? Fear not, we've got a solution for you!  This recipe for Meatloaf for Meatloaf  Haters is  light, flavorful, and  perfect for those who  think  they don't like meatloaf.

Ingredients:

* 1 lb ground  meat (beef, pork,  or a  combination of the two)
* 1/2 cup breadcrumbs (preferably Panko)
*  1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
* 1 egg
* 1/4 cup ketchup
* 1/4  cup water
* 1  tbsp Worcestershire  sauce
* 1 tsp dried  oregano
* Salt and pepper to taste
*  1/4 cup chopped onion
* 1/4  cup chopped bell pepper
*  1/4 cup chopped mushrooms
* 1/4 cup chopped bacon (optional)

Instructions:

1. Preheat  your  oven to 375°F (190°C).
2.   In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground  meat, breadcrumbs,  Parmesan  cheese, egg, ketchup, water, Worcestershire sauce,  oregano, salt, and pepper. Mix well with your hands or a spoon until everything  is fully incorporated.
3. Add the chopped onion, bell pepper, mushrooms, and bacon (if using) to the meat    mixture and  mix again  until they are evenly distributed.
4. Transfer the mixture to a loaf  pan lined with  parchment paper  or  aluminum foil.  Smooth the top  and create a small indentation down the center of the  loaf to help the meat cook evenly.
5. Bake  the meatloaf for 45-50 minutes,  or until

Sure! Here's a recipe for Caesar-Roasted Fish:

Ingredients:

* 4 fish fillets (such as cod, halibut, or  snapper)
* 2  tablespoons olive   oil
* 1/4 cup Caesar dressing
* 1/4 cup  lemon juice
* 2 cloves garlic, minced
* 1 teaspoon dried thyme
* Salt and   pepper to taste
* Fresh  parsley, chopped (optional)

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F  (200°C).
2.  Line  a baking sheet with  aluminum foil or  parchment paper.
3. Place the fish  fillets on the  prepared baking sheet.
4. Drizzle  the olive oil over the fish fillets, then brush them evenly with the Caesar  dressing.
5. Sprinkle the  lemon juice, garlic,  and thyme over the  top of each fillet. Season with salt and  pepper to taste.
6. Roast the fish in the preheated oven for  12-15  minutes per inch  of thickness, or until it reaches an internal temperature  of 145°F  (63°C).
7. Remove the fish from the oven and garnish with  chopped fresh  parsley, if  desired.
8. Serve immediately and enjoy!

This recipe is a delicious twist on traditional roasted fish, using Caesar dressing instead of lemon butter or herbs. The creamy, tangy  flavor of the dressing pairs perfectly with the  rich  flavors of the fish, while the lemon juice adds a  bright   burst of citrus. You can serve   this dish with   your favorite sides,  such as  roasted vegetables or quinoa. Enjoy!

Sure!   Here's a simple recipe  for squash and apple  soup:

Ingredients:

*  1 medium-sized butternut squash, peeled and  diced  into small pieces (about 2 cups)
* 3 apples, cored and chopped into small  pieces
* 4 tablespoons unsalted butter or oil
* 2  onions, chopped (about 1  cup)
* 3 cloves garlic, minced
*  2 teaspoons cumin powder
* 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg powder
* Salt and pepper   to   taste
*  Stock   (homemade or low-sodium store-bought)  as  needed
* Freshly  squeezed lemon juice (optional)

Instructions:

1. Preheat your oven  to  400°F (200°C). Place the diced squash on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper,  drizzle with about  2 tablespoons of butter or oil, and season with salt, pepper, and cumin powder. Roast in the preheated oven until tender and lightly browned, stirring occasionally, for about 45 minutes.
2.  While the squash is roasting, heat  another 2 tablespoons of butter or oil  over medium heat in a pot. Add the chopped onions,  cook until softened and translucent, about 8-10 minutes. Add  the minced garlic and sauté for an additional minute.
3. Remove from  heat and  let  cool slightly, then process the roasted squash, onions, garlic, and any accumulated pan  drippings into smaller chunks  using  an immersion  blender  or transfer them to a blender   or  food processor. Blend  until smooth.
4. Transfer the mixture back to the pot if  you  used a blender or food processor and add enough stock to cover all  the ingredients.   Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce heat  to low and Cook until heated through,  5–7 minutes. Season with salt, nutmeg, and more  cumin to taste

Sure! Here's a recipe for Purple Potato Mash Up:

Ingredients:

* 3-4 large  purple potatoes, peeled and  chopped into 1-inch cubes
* 1/4 cup milk  or half-and-half
* 2  tablespoons butter
*  1/2 teaspoon salt
*  1/4  teaspoon black pepper
* 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
* 1/4 teaspoon paprika
* 1/4 cup grated cheddar cheese (optional)
*  Chopped fresh herbs,  such as  parsley or chives (optional)

Instructions:

1. Place the  chopped potatoes in a  large pot and add enough cold water to cover them. Bring to a   boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low  and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the potatoes  are  tender when  pierced with a fork.
2. Drain   the potatoes and return them to   the pot. Add the milk, butter,  salt, black pepper,  garlic powder, and paprika. Mash the potatoes with  a potato masher  or a fork until  they're  smooth and creamy.
3.  If using, stir in the grated cheddar cheese until it's  fully  incorporated.
4. Taste  and adjust the seasoning as needed.
5.  Serve the  mashed potatoes hot, garnished with chopped fresh  herbs if desired. Enjoy!

Note: You can also add some diced cooked bacon, ham, or sautéed onions and bell  peppers to the mashed potatoes for added flavor and  texture. Experiment  with different combinations  to  find your  favorite variation of this delicious side dish!

Sure! Here's a recipe for  Spiced Round of Beef:

Ingredients:

* 1 (3-4  pound) round of beef, tied  with kitchen  twine
* 2 tablespoons brown   sugar
*  1 tablespoon smoked paprika
* 1 tablespoon ground cumin
* 1 tablespoon coriander
*  1 teaspoon garlic powder
* 1 teaspoon  onion powder
* 1 teaspoon salt
* 1/2  teaspoon black pepper
* 1/4  cup red  wine vinegar
*  1/4 cup olive oil
*   2 cloves garlic, minced
* 1 tablespoon chopped  fresh thyme

Instructions:

1. Preheat your  oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix together the brown  sugar, smoked paprika, cumin, coriander, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and black pepper.
3. Heat the  red wine vinegar and olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until the   vinegar  has almost completely evaporated, leaving just a glaze.
4. Add the  minced garlic  to the skillet and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly, until fragrant.
5. Place  the round   of beef onto  a rimmed baking sheet or roasting  pan, fat side up.  Brush the garlic and herb mixture all over the   surface of the meat, making  sure to coat it  evenly.
6. Sprinkle the spice blend evenly  over the top of   the beef, pressing gently into the meat  so that it adheres well.
7. Roast   the  beef in  the preheated oven for about  2 hours, or until it  reaches  an internal temperature of 135°F (57°C) for medium-rare. Baste the beef  every  30 minutes during cooking.
8. Remove the beef from the oven and let it rest for 10

Frijoles  Borrachos, also known as "Drunk Beans," is a popular Mexican side  dish or appetizer. The  name "borracho" means drunk in Spanish, and the name of  this dish literally  translates to "drunken beans." This  recipe yields  approximately 6 servings.

Ingredients:

* 1 lb. dried  black beans, soaked overnight and drained
* 1 tablespoon  vegetable  oil
* 2 cloves garlic, minced
* 1 small onion,   diced
* 1 chipotle pepper in adobo  sauce, finely chopped (optional)
* 9 oz. beef broth
* 3 oz.   red wine (such  as Rioja or Merlot)
* 1 teaspoon ground cumin
* 1  teaspoon  paprika
* Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
* Chopped fresh  cilantro leaves, garnish
* Shredded  Monterey Jack cheese  or queso fresco, optional
* Sour cream or   Greek yogurt, optional
* Corn tortillas or chips, for serving

Instructions:

1. In a large Dutch oven or pot  with a  tight-fitting lid,  combine  beef broth, red wine, garlic, onion, cumin, paprika,  salt, and pepper. Stir well.
2. Pour  in the soaked black beans and bring  mixture to  a boil over high   heat,  uncovered.
3. Reduce  heat  to low, cover pot with  lid  slightly askew and let simmer 45 minutes,  stirring occasionally until liquid has been absorbed. Black beans  should still have some  bite; if too dry, add water by tablespoons. Remove  from heat and set aside  while preparing chipotle topping.
4. To  make the chipotle  topping, carefully  remove the seeds and membranes from the chipotle peppers, then mince them. In a skillet, warm the vegetable oil over medium heat.  Add the minced chipotles and sa

Sure, here's a recipe for vegan  walnut pie flavor soft cookies:

Ingredients:

* 1 cup all-purpose flour
* 1/2 cup unsweetened almond  milk
* 1/4 cup  canola oil
* 1/4 cup vegan butter,  melted
* 1/2  cup granulated sugar
* 1/2 cup brown sugar
* 1  tsp vanilla extract
* 1 tsp apple cider  vinegar
*  1/2 tsp salt
* 1  cup chopped walnuts
* 1 tbsp cornstarch
* 1/4 cup maple syrup
*  1/4  cup chopped dark chocolate  (optional)

Instructions:

1. Preheat  the oven to   375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet  with parchment paper.
2. In a large  mixing bowl, whisk together the flour,  sugar, brown sugar,  salt, and cornstarch.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together  the  almond  milk, oil, melted vegan butter, vanilla extract, and apple cider   vinegar.
4. Pour the wet ingredients  into  the dry ingredients and stir until a dough forms. Fold in the chopped walnuts and  chocolate  chips (if using).
5. Scoop tablespoon-sized balls of dough onto  the prepared  baking sheet, leaving  about 2 inches  of  space between  each cookie.
6.  Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden brown.
7. Remove the cookies  from the  oven and  let them cool on the baking sheet  for 5 minutes before transferring them  to a  wire rack to cool completely.
8. In a small  bowl, whisk together the maple syrup and chopped walnuts. Drizzle the mixture over the cooled cookies and let it set  before serving.

Enjoy your delicious vegan walnut  pie flavor soft  cookies

Sure! Here's a recipe for Ingram's Old Fashioned Sugar  Cookies:

Ingredients:

* 2  cups all-purpose flour
* 1   teaspoon baking powder
* 1  teaspoon  baking  soda
* 1 teaspoon salt
* 1 cup  unsalted butter, softened
* 3/4 cup granulated   sugar
* 1/4 cup brown sugar
* 1 egg
* 1 teaspoon vanilla  extract
* Colored sugar or  sprinkles  for decorating (optional)

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven   to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with  parchment  paper or a silicone mat.
2. In a medium  bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder,  baking soda, and salt.  Set aside.
3. In a large bowl, use an electric  mixer to  beat the butter  and sugars  until light and fluffy, about 2  minutes.  Beat  in the egg and vanilla extract until well  combined.
4. Gradually add the dry  ingredients to  the wet ingredients, beating on low speed until a dough forms.
5. If  desired, divide the dough  into two portions and mix in different  colors of food coloring to create a marbled effect.
6. Roll out the  dough on a  floured  surface to about 1/4 inch thickness.  Cut into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or the  rim of a glass.
7. Place  the cookies on the prepared baking sheet, leaving about 1 inch of space between each cookie.
8.  Bake for 8-10 minutes,  or until the edges are  lightly golden.
9. Allow the cookies  to cool on  the  baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring them to a wire  rack to   cool completely.
10. If desired,  decorate the cooled cookies with colored sugar or sprinkles.
11. Store the  cookies in an  airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days

*   1 cup heavy cream
* 1/2 cup  granulated sugar
*  1/2 teaspoon salt
* 1/4  teaspoon ground cinnamon
* 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
* 1/4 teaspoon   ground ginger
* 1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract
* 1/4   cup canned pumpkin purée
* 6 large egg yolks
*   Freshly grated nutmeg,  for garnish

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 300°F (150°C).
2. In  a medium saucepan, combine the heavens cream, sugar, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger.   Heat over  medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar  has dissolved and  the mixture is hot but  not boiling.
3. Remove the saucepan from the heat  and stir in the  vanilla extract and pumpkin purée.
4.   In a small   bowl, whisk together the  egg yolks. Gradually add the warm cream mixture to  the  egg yolks, whisking constantly to prevent the eggs  from scrambling.
5. Pour the mixture into 6-8  ramekins or small baking dishes. Place the ramekins in a large baking dish and pour enough hot water into the baking dish  to come halfway up the  sides of  the ramekins.
6. Bake  for 25-30 minutes, or until the  edges are set and the centers are still slightly  jiggly.
7. Remove  the ramekins from the oven and let them cool   to room temperature. Cover and refrigerate  for at least 2 hours or overnight.

*   1 tablespoon of open-mindedness
* 1/4 teaspoon of willingness to fail
* 1/4 teaspoon  of sense of humor
*  1/4 teaspoon of determination
* 1/4 teaspoon of resourcefulness

Sure! Here's  a recipe for Chewy Chocolate and Orange Delights:

Ingredients:

* 2 cups all-purpose flour
* 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
*  3/4 cup granulated sugar
* 1/4 cup brown  sugar
* 2 teaspoons baking powder
* 1 teaspoon salt
* 2 large  eggs
* 2 tablespoons orange juice
* 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
* 1 cup semisweet chocolate  chips
*  1 cup chopped walnuts (optional)
* Orange zest (optional, for garnish)

Instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Line an 8x8 inch baking dish with parchment paper or aluminum foil, leaving some overhang on the sides  for  easy removal.
2.  In a medium  bowl, whisk  together  the flour,   baking  powder, and salt.  Set  aside.
3. In a large bowl, use  an  electric mixer  to beat the butter and sugars until light and fluffy, about 2-3 minutes. Beat  in the eggs one at a  time, followed by the orange juice and  vanilla extract.
4. Gradually mix in  the dry ingredients until just combined,  being careful not to overmix.
5. Melt the chocolate chips in  a  double boiler or in the microwave in  30-second increments, stirring  between  each heating. Allow the chocolate to cool slightly.
6. Fold the melted chocolate into the batter until well combined. If  using walnuts, fold them in  at this  stage as well.
7. Pour the batter into the  prepared baking dish  and smooth the top.
8.  Bake for  25-30 minutes  or     until the edges  are set  and the center is slightly gooey. A toothpick inserted into  the  center should come  out with a few moist crumbs attached.
9.  Remove  from the oven

Ingredients

1/4 cup chopped onion
1  pound ground beef
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
1/2 teaspoon crushed red  pepper flakes
1 (6 ounce) can  tomato paste
1  (15 ounce) can diced  tomatoes with juice
1/2 cup  water
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
Directions
Heat the  olive oil in a large  skillet over medium heat; cook and stir the garlic and onions  until tender.  Add the ground  beef, salt, pepper, oregano, and red  pepper flakes  to the pan; cook and stir until browned. Stir in the tomato paste, diced  tomatoes, and water;  simmer for about 10 minutes.   Toss the sauce  with the pasta  and sprinkle with Parmesan  cheese before serving.

Yield: 3 dozen

Ingredients:

- 2 cups white sugar
- 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 3 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
-   1/2 teaspoon  salt
- 1/2 cup shortening
- 1 cup milk
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 4 eggs

Directions

1. Preheat oven  to  350 degrees F (175 degrees C).  Grease and  flour three  9 inch round pans and line with parchment paper.   Sift together the sugar, flour, baking powder, and salt. Set  aside.
2. In a large bowl,  beat shortening  until light and fluffy.
3. Add milk and vanilla extract  and combine well.
4. Add eggs, one at   a time, stirring  after each addition.
5. Gradually  add the flour mixture, beating well  after each addition.
6. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to  25 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

Ingredients

- 1 cup butter
- 1 1/3 cups white sugar
- 2 egg yolks
- 2 tablespoons milk
- 2  teaspoons vanilla extract
- 3 cups sifted confectioners' sugar

Directions

1.  Beat  butter  and shortening together  until  creamy, about 2  minutes.
2. Add white sugar and continue beating until fluffy, 4 to    6 minutes.
3. Add   egg yolks one at a time. Alternately add confectioner's sugar, one   cup  at   a time with milk. Blend in  vanilla.
4. Refrigerate to add  firmness before frosting cake.

"INGREDIENTS
2 (18-lb)  turkeys
1/2 cup coarse salt
4  onions, quartered
1 orange, halved
2 heads garlic, halved
Aromatics: your choice
2 tablespoons brown sugar
DIRECTIONS
Rinse each  turkey  with cold running water inside  and out. Pat dry. Sprinkle the salt evenly inside each turkey  cavity. Place a turkey on  an oven-proof rack,  set on a shallow pan.  Stuff the neck   opening with the onion,  orange, and the  garlic, placing a couple  of bay leaves, celery  leaf, and thyme in the cavity.

Spread the wings  over the back of   the turkey. Cover the turkey with foil. Place in the refrigerator for   two days.

Unwrap turkey an hour before cooking. Heat oven to 450 degrees F.   Brush turkey with brown sugar. Place in oven, and roast  for   1  hour. Lower heat  to 350 degrees F, and roast   2 1/2 hours longer, or until meat thermometer inserted in thigh reads 180  degrees F. Cooking time may vary due to  difference  in the size of  individual turkeys."

- A few sprigs of fresh rosemary

-  Half a bag of fresh baby dill sprigs
-  The insides  from a head of garlic
- 2  tsp. whole black peppercorns
-  2 tsp. whole coriander seeds
- 2  tsp. fennel seed"

Ingredients:
1/2 cup butter, divided

Return the pork  chops to  the sauce, cover,  and reduce heat to low. Simmer until the meat is tender, about 30  minutes.

Sure! Here's a   simple   recipe to make Blistered Okra with  Dill-Coriander Lebneh.

Ingredients:

* 2 cups okra,  washed and chopped into bite-sized pieces
* Olive oil
* Salt and  black pepper  (to taste)
* Fresh lemon juice  (optional)

For the dill-coriander  lebneh:

*   1 cup  plain  yogurt (Greek or Middle Eastern style)
* ¼ cup fresh dill leaves, finely chopped
* ¼ cup coriander leaves, finely chopped
* 1 clove garlic, minced
* 1 tbsp  olive  oil
*  Salt and black pepper (to taste)
* Zest of one lemon  (optional)

Instructions:

To make the blistered okra, heat a large skillet over  medium-high heat. Add  about 2 tablespoons of olive oil  and season with  salt and black pepper to  taste. Once  heated through, add in the okra and  toss to coat  in oil and spices.  Cook  for 4-5 minutes on each side or until  the  okra is tender  and slightly charred. Squeeze  extra lemon juice  on top if desired and serve hot  with  dill-coriander lebneh on the side.

To make the dill-coriander  lebnek, place the yogurt in a strainer set inside  a  mixing bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight to allow any excess liquid to  drain out. In a small blender, combine the chopped herbs, garlic, olive  oil, and seasonings to taste. Pour  this mixture over the  yogurt and stir to combine. You can continue  to  mix by hand or use the  blender to puree until it  reaches your desired consistency.  If you  prefer a smoother texture, you can also strain off some of the solids using cheesecloth or a  muslin cloth. Serve chilled alongside  the blistered okra.

Classic Buttermilk Biscuits (Nytimes)

Ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose   flour
- 1  tablespoon baking powder
- 3/4  teaspoon salt
- 1/2  cup  unsalted butter, cold, cut into small cubes
-   3/4 cup buttermilk
- 1  large egg
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking  soda
-  1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the  flour,  baking powder, and salt.
2. Add  the cold butter  cubes to the dry ingredients  and mix  with your hands or a  pastry cutter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
3.  In a separate  bowl, whisk  together  the buttermilk, egg, sugar, baking soda, and cream of tartar.
4. Pour  the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until  just combined.
5. On a lightly floured  surface,  knead the  dough until it comes together, then roll it out to about 1 inch thickness.
6. Use a biscuit cutter to  cut out the   biscuits and place  them on a baking sheet lined  with parchment paper.
7.  Bake at 425°F for 12-15 minutes, or until the   biscuits are golden brown on top and bottom.
8. Serve warm with your favorite toppings, such as honey, butter, or jam. Enjoy!

Poached Pears with Saffron Broth  Recipe

Ingredients:
- 4 ripe pears
- 1 cup water
- 1  cup white wine
-  1/4 cup sugar
- 1 cinnamon stick
- 5 whole cloves
-  1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
-  1/4 cup   freshly  squeezed lemon juice
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh  parsley
- 1/4  cup chopped fresh  mint
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh dill
- Saffron threads,  for garnish

Instructions:

1.  In a large  saucepan, combine the water, white wine, sugar, cinnamon stick, cloves, nutmeg,  and salt.  Bring the mixture to  a boil over medium-high heat, stirring to dissolve the sugar.
2.  Reduce the heat to medium-low  and simmer for 10 minutes.
3. Meanwhile, peel, core, and halve the  pears. Arrange the pears, cut side up, in a large heatproof dish or baking  dish.
4. Pour the hot broth over the pears, making sure they are completely submerged.   Cover the dish  with   aluminum foil and let  it sit at room temperature for  at least 2 hours,  or refrigerate overnight.
5. To serve, remove the pears from the broth with a slotted spoon and drain well. Arrange the pears  on a serving platter and pour the broth over them.
6. Garnish with  fresh  parsley, mint,  and dill.  Sprinkle  saffron threads over the top  for added color and flavor.
7. Serve immediately  and enjoy   your  delicious Poached Pears  with Saffron Broth!

Asparagus  Sheaves  Kambu Recipe

Ingredients:

* 1 pound asparagus,  trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
* 1/2 cup kambu  (Japanese dried seaweed)
* 4 cups water
* 1 tablespoon soy sauce
*  1  tablespoon mirin
* 1 tablespoon   sugar
* 1 teaspoon grated ginger
* 2 cloves garlic, minced
* 1/4 cup chopped green  onions
* Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

1.  In a   large  pot, bring the water  to a boil. Add   the kambu and let it soak for  5 minutes.
2. Add the asparagus to the pot and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until tender.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, mirin,  sugar, ginger, and  garlic.
4. Pour the sauce over  the asparagus and kambu and stir to coat.
5. Cook for an additional 2-3  minutes, or until the   sauce has thickened.
6. Remove  the pot from the heat and  stir in the chopped  green onions.
7. Season with salt  and  pepper to taste.
8. Serve  hot and enjoy!

Mujadarrah is a delicious and  hearty vegetarian dish  that originated in  the Middle East. It is a one-pot  meal  that is easy to prepare and packed with flavor. Here  is a simple recipe that serves 4  people:

Ingredients:

*  1 tablespoon olive oil
*  1 large onion, chopped
* 2 cloves  garlic, minced
* 1 teaspoon ground cumin
* 1 teaspoon ground  coriander
* 1 teaspoon paprika
* 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
* 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)
* 1  can  lentils, rinsed and drained
* 1 can diced tomatoes
* 4  cups  vegetable broth
* 1/2 cup chopped fresh parsley
* Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

1. Heat the olive oil in  a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic and  sauté until the onion is soft and  translucent,  about 5 minutes.
2. Add the ground cumin, coriander,  paprika, turmeric,  and cayenne pepper (if using) to the pot and stir to combine. Cook for another minute, until   fragrant.
3. Add the lentils, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth  to the  pot. Stir to combine.
4. Bring the mixture to a boil,  then reduce  the heat to low and let it simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the lentils are tender and  the sauce  has  thickened.
5.  Remove the  pot  from the heat and   stir  in the chopped  fresh  parsley. Season with salt  and  pepper  to taste.
6.  Serve the mujadarrah hot, with rice or pita bread on the  side. Enjoy!

Honey Bunnies  Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 teaspoons  baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 3 tablespoons  honey
- 1  cup milk
- 2 large eggs
- 6 tablespoons  unsalted butter,  melted and cooled
- Vegetable oil spray
-  Powdered   sugar, for dusting

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lightly coat it  with vegetable oil  spray.
2. In a medium bowl,  whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
3.  In another medium bowl, mix together the honey, milk, eggs, and   melted butter until well combined. Add the wet ingredients to  the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Do not overmix.
4. Using an ice cream scoop or spoon, drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
5. Bake  for 12-15 minutes, or  until the  buns are golden brown on top and  a toothpick inserted into the  center comes  out clean.
6. Remove from the  oven and let  cool on    the baking sheet for 5  minutes before  transferring  to   a wire rack to  cool  completely.
7. Once cooled, dust with powdered sugar  and serve.  Enjoy  your delicious Honey Bunnies!

Almighty Chocolate Divinity Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 cup granulated sugar
-  1/2 cup unsalted butter
- 1/2  cup heavy cream
-  4 large  egg yolks
-  1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 8 ounces semi-sweet chocolate, chopped
- 1/4 teaspoon  salt
-   1/2 cup chopped  walnuts or pecans (optional)

Instructions:

1. In a  medium saucepan, combine sugar,  butter, and cream. Cook over medium heat, stirring  constantly, until the mixture  comes to a  boil.
2. In a separate  bowl, whisk  together egg yolks and vanilla extract until well combined.
3. Slowly  pour the hot cream mixture into the egg yolk  mixture, whisking constantly.
4. Pour the mixture back into  the saucepan  and cook over  medium heat, stirring  constantly, for  2-3 minutes or until the mixture thickens and   coats the back  of a spoon.
5. Remove  the saucepan from heat and stir in chopped chocolate  and salt  until completely melted and smooth.
6. Fold in  chopped nuts, if using.
7. Pour the mixture into  a  greased 9x13  inch baking dish and let it cool at room temperature for several hours or  until completely set.
8. Cut into squares and serve chilled. Enjoy your Almighty Chocolate Divinity!
